 <h2>
  <a name="A_About_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      1. About this policy
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="A_Why_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     1.1 Why this policy
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   This policy lists the rules you must apply when assessing residential security collateral risk for consumer mortgage lending.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <strong>
     Note
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    : N
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     on-specialised commercial security collateral may be considered on an
     <strong>
      <span>
       exception
      </span>
     </strong>
     basis when approved by Credit.
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The bank performs several validation checks in our origination system. These additional checks form part of the overall valuation strategy and policy.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   Refer to this policy in conjunction with
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000682">
    <em>
     Acceptable Security Collateral
    </em>
   </a>
  </span>
  and
  <em>
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
    Loan to Value Ratio (LVR)
   </a>
   &gt; Calculating the LVR and Security value.
  </em>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   For definitions relating to this policy, refer to
  </span>
 </span>
 <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000723">
  <em>
   <span>
    <span>
     Glossary
    </span>
   </span>
  </em>
 </a>
 <span>
  <span>
   .
   <br/>
   <br/>
   If the loan application requires mortgage insurance, refer to
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000725">
    <em>
     Lenders Mortgage Insurance
    </em>
   </a>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   where required.
   <br/>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <a name="A_Security_collateral_value">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      1.2 Security collateral value - Market Value
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   Market value for real estate is defined as:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   ‘The estimated amount which a seller would expect to receive from an informed purchaser for the property in the current resale market with normal marketing support through an Australian based real estate agency. The market value is determined on a vacant possession basis and must exclude purchase incentives, non-fixed chattels, legal / stamp duty costs and rental guarantees.’
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   A market value assessed on this basis will
   <strong>
    <span>
     not
    </span>
   </strong>
   reflect the mortgagee in possession or other forced sale circumstances.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 Also see:
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <a href="#R_More_than_one_market_value">
       More than one market value
      </a>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <a href="#R_Contract_of_Sales_(Purchase_Price)">
       Contract of Sale (COS)
      </a>
      <span>
       <span>
       </span>
      </span>
      <br/>
      <span>
       <span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_What_are_acceptable_real_estate_valuat">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      1.3 What are acceptable real estate valuation methods?
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   The bank accepts the following real estate valuation methods and will apply the below hierarchy where multiple valuations are held within the acceptable age limit:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ol>
  <li>
   Residential  &amp; Construction Long Form valuation
  </li>
  <li>
   Residential &amp; Construction Short Form valuation
  </li>
  <li>
   Desktop valuation
  </li>
  <li>
   Automated Valuation Model (AVM) (also known as  Modelled Estimate, Electronic Assessment, E-Val)
  </li>
 </ol>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    e.g. If the existing valuations are AVM, Desktop and Short Form, then use the Short Form
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <a name="R_Rules_you_must_apply">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2. Rules you must apply
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Amending_the_customer_estimated_market">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     2.1 Customer estimated market value
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 The customer estimated market value is the estimated dollar value the customer provides us of their residential real estate property.
 <br/>
 During the R&amp;O conversation a discussion would be had with the customer about the amount of funding they require and what the funds would be used for. It is reasonable to assume the customer estimate value of their property is sufficient to meet their needs in line with the R&amp;O.
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   The customer estimated market value is not to be amended within an application once a valuation (any type) has been completed.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 Also see
 <a href="#2.10 Automated Valuation Model (AVM)">
  Automated Valuation Model (AVM)
 </a>
 .
 <br/>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Assessing_security_collateral_value_us">
   <strong>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.2 Assessing security collateral value using the valuation report
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   Valuation reports are only to be accepted from valuers on the Westpac Group approved Residential Valuer panel. All valuation reports are to be addressed to the Bank.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Requesting_a_Valuation_Report">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     2.3 Requesting a Valuation Report
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   A valuation report:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     can only be requested by an authorised staff member or Broker of Westpac Banking Group and must be ordered via Property Hub
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <strong>
        <span>
         cannot be
        </span>
       </strong>
       requested for the purchase of a property where the offer has not been accepted by the owner (to assist a prospective purchaser e.g. pre-purchase valuations are not permitted )
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
  <a name="R__Ownership_of_Valuation_Report">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.4 Ownership of Valuation Report
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   All valuation reports remain the property of the Bank and should not be offered to the customer. Reports are prepared for and addressed to the Bank for residential mortgage lending purposes.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 If a customer requires a copy of the bank valuation to support their application for a grant, the customer is to complete the ‘ Customer declaration and acknowledgement ’ form and only on receipt of the signed form can the valuation be provided to the customer.
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>

 <h3>
  <a name="R_Reading_the_Valuation_Report">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.5 Reading the Valuation Report
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   The valuation report must be read in its entirety. Adverse comments in the valuation report may make the property unacceptable as security collateral, characteristics are to be further investigated and where necessary, the application is to be referred to Credit.
   <br/>
   <br/>
   Refer to
   <a href="#P_Residential_Short_Form_Valuation">
    <em>
     Process &gt; Reviewing and actioning a Residential Short Form Valuation
    </em>
   </a>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>

 <h3>
  <a name="R_More_than_one_market_value">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.7 More than one market value
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   In situations where more than 1 market value is available on the one valuation report, use the lower of the values except where:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Credit (or other Credit Risk authorised staff) have approved using a higher value, or
  </li>
  <li>
   Where the below applies
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   Where the security collateral is subject to a Defence Housing Authority (DHA) sale and leaseback arrangement, the panel valuer's valuation report will contain 2 property values. The lower figure represents the vacant possession value. The higher figure is the vacant possession value plus the worth of the government rental guarantee. Where the loan is mortgage insured or requires a valuation, then the higher figure is acceptable if:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   The rental guarantee assessment is
   <strong>
    <span>
     not
    </span>
   </strong>
   greater than 110% of the vacant possession assessment
  </li>
  <li>
   The loan is amortising
  </li>
  <li>
   The lease has 6 or more years to run excluding options to renew. Where the loan is
   <strong>
    <span>
     not
    </span>
   </strong>
   subject to mortgage insurance or the LVR ≤ 80%, then the higher valuation figure is acceptable.
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Contract_of_Sales_(Purchase_Price)">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.8 Contract of Sales (Purchase Price)
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 A Contact of Sale (COS) is not to be used in isolation as a security collateral value assessment.
 <br/>
 Also see:
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Requirements to obtain a COS
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Review of COS
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Minimum criteria to be obtained from the COS
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Automated Valuation Model (
         <a>
          AVM
         </a>
         )
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h4>
  <a id="2.8.1 Requirements to obtain a COS" name="2.8.1 Requirements to obtain a COS">
   <strong>
    2.8.1 Requirements to obtain a COS
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h4>
 A fully executed contract by the vendor and purchaser
 <b>
  must be held prior to settlement
 </b>
 where:
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      The application is to be mortgage insured
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      The application includes a First Home Owner Grant (FHOG)
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      An AVM is being used to validate the purchase price as the security valuation method. You must identify if the purchase price includes any non-fixed chattels, rebates or incentives offered.
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 A full copy of the COS (does not need to be fully executed) must be held when an SDR assessment is required on the property being purchased.
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   For all other circumstances a full copy of the COS is preferred but not mandatory.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h4>
  <a id="2.8.2 Review of COS" name="2.8.2 Review of COS">
   2.8.2 Review of COS
  </a>
 </h4>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    A COS
    <ins datetime="2022-10-13T09:55">
     received during the application process
    </ins>
    must be reviewed to:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <ins datetime="2022-10-13T09:56">
       ensure the security meets
      </ins>
      the below criteria
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <span>
    :
   </span>
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          the property must be zoned to allow residential usage. For further information refer to
          <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000682">
           Acceptable Security Collateral
          </a>
          policy &gt; Assessing security collateral requirements
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            <span>
             the cost / value of any chattels (e.g. furnishings) and / or rebates or incentives being offered by the vendor are to be deducted from the total purchase price to determine the security value. Refer to
             <a data-tagid="2.9 Chattels, Rebates and Incentives" href="#2.9 Chattels, Rebates and Incentives">
              Chattels, Rebates and Incentives
             </a>
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     the security is being purchased
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   Request a valuation report via Property Hub where it is identified that:
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         the transaction is
         <b>
          not
         </b>
         being completed at arm's length through an independent Australian based real estate agent (i.e. it is a private sale), or
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         the Contract of Sale indicates a ‘Put and Call’ contract , or
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         the Contract of Sale is older than 3 months
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
 </ul>
 If the COS is undated and is
 <b>
  not
 </b>
 a First Home Owners Grant (FHOG) application, assume that the contract date is the date the Privacy Consent was obtained.
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <ins datetime="2022-10-13T10:03">
  Also refer to:
 </ins>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <a data-tagid="R_Contract_of_Sales_(Purchase_Price)" href="#R_Contract_of_Sales_(Purchase_Price)">
    <span>
     <span>
      <ins datetime="2022-10-13T10:05">
       Contract of sale (purchase price)
      </ins>
     </span>
    </span>
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <ins datetime="2022-10-13T10:08">
        <a data-tagid="2.8.3 Minimum Criteria to be obtained from the Contract of Sale" href="#2.8.3 Minimum Criteria to be obtained from the Contract of Sale">
         Minimum criteria to be obtained from the Contract of Sale
        </a>
       </ins>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h4>
  <a id="2.8.3 Minimum Criteria to be obtained from the Contract of Sale" name="2.8.3 Minimum Criteria to be obtained from the Contract of Sale">
   <b>
    2.8.3
   </b>
   <strong>
    <span>
     <span>
      Minimum Criteria to be obtained from the Contract of Sale
     </span>
    </span>
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h4>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Where you are required to obtain a copy of the contract of sale, the document must display the minimum criteria as per
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000692">
       Document Standards
      </a>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <br/>
  <a id="2.9 Chattels, Rebates and Incentives" name="2.9 Chattels, Rebates and Incentives">
   2.9 Chattels, Rebates and Incentives
  </a>
 </h3>
 Where a contract of sale includes any non-fixed chattels
 <a href="#2.9.1 Chattels">
  <sup>
   #
  </sup>
 </a>
 , Rebates or Incentives offered, the cost / value of any non-fixed chattels (e.g. furnishings) and / or the value of any rebates or incentives offered by the vendor are to be deducted from the total purchase price to determine the security value which is entered in the origination platform.
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Where this adjustment to the security value is required, an AVM can-not be used to validate the COS purchase price. The AVM is not to be ordered and the next higher valuation type is to be requested.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <h4>
  <a id="2.9.1 Chattels" name="2.9.1 Chattels">
   <b>
    2.9.1 Chattels

    <span>
     <span>
      Window treatments
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <br/>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <a id="2.10 Automated Valuation Model (AVM)" name="2.10 Automated Valuation Model (AVM)">
     2.10 Automated Valuation Model (AVM)
    </a>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 An Automated Valuation Model (AVM) is an electronic valuation that is completed based on recent property sales in the area. They are also known as Modelled Estimate, Electronic Assessment or E-Vals. An AVM is a brief report that indicates the amount the property is worth.
 <br/>
 <br/>
 Where an AVM search on a security collateral property is successful, it is used to validate the purchase price (COS)
 <b>
  or
 </b>
 the customer estimated market value. The validation is restricted to:
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       the specific customer the AVM was ordered for, and
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       only being used where the LVR for the loan (i.e. the LVR inclusive of all security values) is
       <strong>
        <span>
         equal to or less than
        </span>
       </strong>
       the
       <strong>
        <span>
         maximum end LVR
        </span>
       </strong>
       (i.e. capitalised LVR) value returned with the search.
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Where an AVM for a security collateral in the loan returns a maximum end LVR result that is less than the LVR for the loan, then the security collateral will require an alternate valuation method (either a Desktop if policy permits, or a full valuation).
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <b>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     Where an AVM has been completed, the customer estimated market value is not to be amended
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </b>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    . The AVM result can only be relied upon based on the original customer estimated market value or contract price.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <div>
  <div>
   <div id="_com_1" language="JavaScript">
    <h3>
     <br/>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <a id="2.13 Valuation amount lower than purchase price" name="2.13 Valuation amount lower than purchase price">
        2.11 Valuation amount lower than purchase price
       </a>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </h3>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       There may be circumstances in which the valuation of a property is significantly less than the stated purchase price.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       Where the valuation amount is less than 90% of the purchase price, the customers (and guarantor/s if any) are to be informed in writing and their written acknowledgement obtained.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       For applications approved via OBP, borrower/s are informed of, and acknowledge their acceptance (wet signature or digital) via the application 'playback 'document, which is part of the loan offer pack. Guarantor/s receive the application 'playback 'document with their guarantee documents to review before signing a
       <a>
        guarantee
       </a>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
    <br/>
   </div>
  </div>
 </div>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Re-using_an_Existing_Valuation">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.12 Re-using an Existing Valuation
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   Valuation methods previously used to determine the value of a security collateral are stored in the Bank’s system and ValEx and may be re-used subject to meeting policy requirements.
   <br/>
   Existing valuation results (excluding AVM) held in the valuation system for a specific property may be used for a different customer as a valid existing valuation in terms of assessing residential security.
  </span>
 </span>

  <br/>

 <h3>
  <br/>
  <a name="R_Assessing_non-real_estate_security_col">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     2.14  Assessing non-real estate security collateral value
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   The only acceptable non-real estate security collateral is a term deposit. The market value of a term deposit is determined by the face value of the investment.
   <br/>
   <strong>
    <span>
     Note:
    </span>
   </strong>
  </span>
  This security type is not available for mortgage insured applications.
 </span>
 <br/>
 <h3>
  <br/>
  <a name="R_Valuation_Review_And_Check_Valuations">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.15 Valuation Review
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   If the below criteria, applies the valuation cannot be reviewed / challenged:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Security assessment is an electronic (E-val) assessment or desktop assessment
  </li>
  <li>
   The resultant LVR is within acceptable non mortgaged insured lending guidelines
  </li>
  <li>
   Date of the escalation is more than one month from the date of the valuation
  </li>
  <li>
   If a loan is mortgage insured by Helia (formerly Genworth)
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
 </h3>
 <h2>
  <a name="P_Process_to_follow">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      3. Process to follow
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
 </h3>
 <h3>
  <a name="P_Desktop_Valuation">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      3.1 Desktop Valuation
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <br/>
   The Desktop Valuation result will be provided with a detailed message based on the following policy parameters:
   <br/>
   <br/>
   Contract price or estimated market value is validated when the Desktop is not more than 10% or not more than $50,000 under the contract amount or estimated market value. Use the contract amount or estimated market value.
   <br/>
   <br/>
   Contract price is not validated. A Residential Short Form Valuation must be ordered.
   <br/>
   <br/>
   If estimated market value is not validated, the Desktop price estimate result may be used.
   <br/>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <a name="P_Residential_Short_Form_Valuation">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      3.2 Residential Short Form Valuation
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <h3>
 </h3>
 <h4>
  <a name="P_Reviewing_and_actioning_a_Residential_">
   <strong>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       3.2.1 Reviewing and actioning a Residential Short Form Valuation:
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h4>
 <span>
  <span>
   Residential Short Form valuation reports showing any of the following features must be referred to Credit to determine if the property is acceptable as collateral security:
  </span>
 </span>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="626">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <h4>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          Loan Type
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </h4>
    </td>
    <td>
     <h4>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          Feature requiring referral
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </h4>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td rowspan="4">
     <span>
      <span>
       Mortgage Insured loan
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Any of the below:
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       The Valuation Risk Alerts (VRAs) answered ‘Yes’ to
      </span>
     </span>
     <ol>
      <li>
       Does the subject property comprise a higher risk or a non-residential property type?
      </li>
      <li>
       Are there any adverse marketability issues that would require an extended selling period of more than 6 months?
      </li>
      <li>
       Are the existing improvements on the property incomplete, under construction or requiring essential repairs?
      </li>
      <li>
       Is the subject property critically affected by any Heritage, location or environmental issues?
      </li>
     </ol>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Any other Critical Risk or adverse features highlighted in valuer's comments (other than above)
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       1. "Critical" risks - specific to the subject property and/or considered to have a negative impact on marketability or value of the subject property
       <br/>
       2. Adverse features evident on the valuation.
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       Defined as "Any material adverse risks affecting the subject property " including but not limited to:
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       property incomplete or poorly maintained and in need of repairs (Essential Repairs / Repairs &gt;$5k).
      </li>
      <li>
       being sold by a builder/developer (where valuer comment relates to Rebates, cash-back arrangements evident or other adverse comments relating to Purchase or Building Contracts)
      </li>
      <li>
       any part of the property not being used for its designed purpose, is something other than strictly residential, any structures/ improvements that may not be council approved
      </li>
      <li>
       property is affected by a "critical risk" attributable to any heritage, location or environmental issues (the risk is specific to the property and is not generally accepted by the market)
      </li>
      <li>
       the property saleability and/or value may be adversely affected by a "critical risk" specific to the property, or known/observable encumbrances, issues or on-going heightened concern as advised by the valuer, that is not generally accepted by the market or results is restricted marketability  (e.g. RTA affectation, restricted use, adverse easements , proximity to Railway Lines , Commercial/Industrial Area, Adverse Zoning, restricted use/unique in nature)
      </li>
      <li>
       Selling period &gt;6 months
      </li>
      <li>
       Minimum requirements for Sales Evidence unavailable/ Lack of acceptable Comparable Sales. (At least three (3) comparable sales presented.  Comparable sales to be like-for-like (property), preferably within 15% variance and within 6 months of the valuation date.)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <span>
      <span>
       NOTE: Permissible for two (2) comparable sales held within acceptable parameters, in addition with one (1) sale outside supported by a satisfactory explanation and where other strengths are evident within the application.
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Any scenario requiring referral as detailed under
       <a href="#P_Risk_Rating_of_Valuation_Report">
        Risk Rating of Valuation Report
       </a>
       <em>
        .
       </em>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Non-Mortgage Insured loan
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Any scenario requiring referral as detailed under
       <a href="#P_Risk_Rating_of_Valuation_Report">
        Risk Rating of Valuation Report
       </a>
       <em>
        .
       </em>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <h3>
 </h3>
 <h3>
  <a id="3.3 Reviewing and actioning a Residential Long Form Valuation" name="3.3 Reviewing and actioning a Residential Long Form Valuation">
   <strong>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       3.3 Reviewing and actioning a Residential Long Form Valuation
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   Residential Long Form valuation reports are all to be assessed to determine if the property is acceptable as security and the valuation amount to be accepted.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   This Includes (but not limited to):
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Property use and description matches the security characteristics within the loan assessment system– (e.g. Mixed use, Land Size Etc)
  </li>
  <li>
   Review the content of a valuation report in full
  </li>
  <li>
   Where necessary on review of valuation, and adverse features are apparent (including Risk Ratings as below) the application is to be referred to Credit
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   Refer to
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/ci/okcsFattach/getFile/1000686/03.04%20How%20to%20read%20a%20long%20form%20valuation%20guide.pdf">
    <em>
     'How to read a long form valuation'
    </em>
   </a>
  </span>
  <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/ci/okcsFattach/getFile/1000686/03.04%20How%20to%20read%20a%20long%20form%20valuation%20guide.pdf">
  </a>
  guide.
  <br/>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <a name="P_Valuation_Review_and_Check_Valuation">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      3.4 Valuation Review
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <h4>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          Step
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </h4>
    </td>
    <td>
     <h4>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          Action
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </h4>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       1
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Read the valuation in its entirety, as often the valuer’s comments in the report and the comparable sales utilised will explain and/or clarify why the valuation has come in lower than the customer's estimate. At this point the customer’s concerns can be managed by the broker without further consultation or delay.
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       2
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       If after reading the valuation fully and customer is still not satisfied with the explanation provided by the broker
       <strong>
        <span>
         and
        </span>
       </strong>
      </span>
     </span>
     <span>
      <span>
       there is other relevant factual sales information* that supports consideration for a review, then the valuation can be queried as follows:
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       The Broker can request Mortgage Operations to raise a Value Query directly with the Valuer in ValEx system and provide the additional comparable sales for consideration (settled sales will be viewed more favourably).
      </li>
     </ul>
     <span>
      <span>
       <strong>
        Note:
       </strong>
       <br/>
       To ensure service levels are not compromised, communications with the valuer must be kept brief, factual and professional at all times. Inappropriate behaviour will not be tolerated, and all instances will be referred to the respective state general manager for action as required.
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       *Relevant information includes:
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Commentary confirming an oversight or error made by the valuer;
       <strong>
        or
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       Valid Comparable sales (which do not already appear in the valuation report) within the last 6 months, with details of:
       <ul>
        <li>
         Within the same location and not from within the same complex if a new development similar price range
        </li>
        <li>
         Similar with regards to condition, price range, type of property, land size, and layout (bedrooms, bathrooms etc)
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       <strong>
        Note
       </strong>
       : Sales evidence cannot include properties sold directly from the Developer; they must be re-sales.
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     3
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        The valuer will review the valuation query and either agree to adjust the valuation
        <strong>
         or
        </strong>
        reconfirm the original valuation.
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        If the valuer agrees to adjust the valuation, the report will be amended and delivered through ValEx.
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         Note:
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </span>
     <span>
      <span>
       The valuer must support the adjusted valuations with appropriate justifiable comments and/or additional sales evidence. Should CoreLogic compliance identify an issue with the report, it will be returned to the Valuer to review.
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         Note:
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </span>
     <span>
      <span>
       Lodging a query does not guarantee the valuation will be amended, therefore customers should not be prematurely advised of a possible outcome.
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>

 <a href="#R_Definition_of_a_commitment">
  <span>

 <h2>
  <a name="A_About_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     1. About this policy
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Definition_of_a_commitment">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     1.1 Definition of a commitment
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   A commitment is any regular repayment which a
   <strong>
    <span>
     b
    </span>
    <strong>
     <span>
      orrower or income guarantor (Spousal-Income Guarantee or Spousal-Income + Security Guarantee)
     </span>
    </strong>
   </strong>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   may have. Commitments may be referred to as a debt, liability or facility which may be secured or unsecured.  The commitment may vary from payment to payment, like the minimum payment on a credit card or be fixed at a nominated amount, for instance a personal loan repayment with a fixed interest rate.
   <br/>
   <br/>
   Excludes items which are captured within
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000700">
    <em>
     <span>
      Living Expenses
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   policy.
   <br/>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <a name="A_Why_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     1.2 Why this policy
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   This policy will help you in verifying existing commitments and repayment conduct.
   <br/>
   <br/>
   This is a key part of the unsuitability assessment and is required for every applicant who is either a borrower or income-reliant guarantor.
   <br/>
   <br/>
   Verification of the applicant's commitments ensures accurate information is used in completing a financial assessment and serviceability calculation.
   <br/>
   <br/>
   Repayment history on existing debts is considered to be a critical indicator of an applicant's credit worthiness and ability to meet commitments.
   <br/>
   <br/>
   This policy is applicable where the loan activity is a:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   New loan application
  </li>
  <li>
   Loan increase
  </li>
  <li>
   Any servicing (variation) activity requiring a serviceability assessment
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   You may also need to refer to other lending policy rules, including but not limited to:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000710">
    Serviceability assessment
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000698">
    Loan Application and Approval &gt; Validation of information provided by the customer
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000700">
    Living expenses
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000692">
    Document Standards
   </a>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <br/>
   If the loan application requires mortgage insurance, refer to
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000725">
    Lenders Mortgage Insurance
   </a>
   where required.
  </span>
  <br/>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <a name="R_Rules_you_must_apply">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     2. Rules you must apply
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Policy_exclusions">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     2.1 Policy exclusions
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   This policy does not apply to a Bridging ICAP loan without an end debt.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Customer_commitments">
   <strong>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.2 Customer commitments
     </span>
    </span>
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   To ensure we accurately assess our customer's financial position we need to:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Collect information about their commitments.
  </li>
  <li>
   Verify the details of the commitment, refer to:
   <ul>
    <li>
     <a href="#R_Confirm_the_details_of_the_commitment">
      Confirm the details of the commitment
     </a>
    </li>
    <li>
     <a href="#R_Evidence_satisfactory_repayment_histor">
      Financial hardship arrangement check and evidence satisfactory repayment history
     </a>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Conflicting_information">
   <strong>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.3 Conflicting information
     </span>
    </span>
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   Further investigation may be required if we have identified any conflicts between any information (including Comprehensive Credit Bureau Report (CCR) data where applicable) and other supporting documents provided by the applicant.  Refer to
  </span>
 </span>
 <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000698">
  Loan Application and Approval &gt; Validation of information provided by the customer
 </a>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   In addition to the Commitments policy requirements, Brokers are reminded to complete the scrutiny activity as outlined in
  </span>
 </span>
 <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000698">
  Loan Application and Approval &gt; Validation of information provided by the customer
 </a>

 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td colspan="4">
     <a name="R_Details_-_cards_with_FPO">
     </a>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        Credit Cards
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       Cards with an active 'Flexible Payment Option (FPO)' limit only
       <br/>
       <br/>
       A card:
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         without a credit (spending) limit, but
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         with an active Flexible Payment Option limit, e.g. some Amex and Diners cards.
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <span>
      <span>
       FPO means portion of the Cards balance can be paid over an extended period (per a standard card) with the remaining balance to be paid in full
       <br/>
       <br/>
       Refer

 <table>
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td colspan="2">
     <a name="R_Details_-_tax_bill">
     </a>
     <strong>
      Tax Bill
     </strong>
     <br/>
     Refer to Glossary for definition
     <br/>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     Required
    </td>
    <td>
     As the payment is not due (it is a bill not a debt), a tax bill is not treated as a commitment.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     Where the customer advises you they have a Tax Bill not yet due, or your supporting document (e.g. ATO NOA) indicates an amount due on a future date:
     <ul>
      <li>
       During the discussion with the customer, record in ApplyOnline notes the discussion you have with the customer as to how they will meet the future ATO bill by the due date.
      </li>
      <li>
       Amount is not included as an outgo in ApplyOnline. You are not required to obtain further supporting documents to evidence of how the future bill will be paid.
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>

  <tbody>
   <tr>

   <tr>

      </span>
     </span>

     <br/>
     Also see:

       </a>
       details the  payment amount which can be entered into the loan assessment system
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     Required
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Amount of payment
      </li>
      <li>
       Frequency
      </li>

      Note:
     </strong>

      </li>

 <table>
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td colspan="3">
     <a name="R_Details_-_tax_debt_type_B">
     </a>
     <strong>
      Tax Debt Type B
      <br/>
     </strong>
     Refer to Glossary for definition
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td colspan="3">
     The commitment details entered into the
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        loan assessment system (e.g. ApplyOnline, Self-Employed Income calculator)
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     must match the information to be verified on the supporting documents except where detailed in
     <a href="#R_Allowable_variances">
      Allowable Variances
     </a>
     <br/>
     <br/>
     Also see:
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a data-tagid="2.5.1 Liabilities and Commitments exempt from financial hardship arrangement checks or conduct checks" href="#2.5.1 Liabilities and Commitments exempt from financial hardship arrangement checks or conduct checks">
        Liabilities and Commitments exempt from financial hardship arrangement or conduct checks
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="#R_Acceptable_documents">
        Acceptable documents
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     Required
    </td>
    <td colspan="2">
     <ul>
      <li>
       Tax Debt-Type B is not to be entered as a commitment (liability) in ApplyOnline
      </li>
      <li>
       <strong>
        No lending or approval (including In Principle Approval)
       </strong>
       is available until all of the below are met:
      </li>
      <li>
       Tax debt - Type B:
       <ul>
        <li>
         Has been repaid via method
         <strong>
          A
         </strong>
         or
         <strong>
          B
         </strong>
         below; or
        </li>
        <li>
         Is being repaid via method
         <strong>
          C
         </strong>
         below, and
        </li>
        <li>
         The associated verification requirements have been met
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       Comments have been entered in the 'Inquiry Outcome' field under additional details explaining how the Tax Debt - Type B was incurred, why it was not paid on time, why the situation will not re-occur, the method used to repay the debt (A, B, C)
      </li>
      <li>
       The application has been referred to Credit and Credit have approved the application for processing
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td colspan="2">
     <strong>
      Repayment method
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <strong>
      Verification requirement
     </strong>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      A
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       The customer has repaid the debt using own funds,
       <strong>
        and
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       Comments have been entered in the 'Inquiry Outcome' field under additional details confirming that the funds used to repay the debt were not required as a customer contribution toward this loan transaction
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Account statement or account transaction listing or account summary / extract / overview evidencing the payment from the borrower's account to the Taxation Office,
       <strong>
        and
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       Australian Taxation Office Letter evidencing the debt is repaid;
       <strong>
        or
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       Australian Taxation Office Portal Document evidencing the debt is repaid
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      B
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       The customer has repaid the debt using funds borrowed from another channel or institution;
       <strong>
        and
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       The new debt has been entered as a liability in ApplyOnline.
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Complete verification according to type of new debt. Refer to the specific commitment type within Confirm details of the commitment;
       <strong>
        and
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       Australian Taxation Office Letter evidencing the debt is repaid;
       <strong>
        or
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       Australian Taxation Office Portal Document evidencing the debt is repaid
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      C
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       The customer has entered into a formal payment plan with the Taxation Office (i.e. the tax debt is now a 'Tax Debt-Type A');
       <strong>
        and
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       The 'Tax Debt-Type A'), has been entered as a liability in ApplyOnline.
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       As per 'Tax Debt -Type A' within Confirm details of the commitment
       <br/>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>

 <h3>
  <a name="R_Evidence_satisfactory_repayment_histor">
   <strong>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.5 Financial hardship arrangement check and evidence satisfactory repayment history
     </span>
    </span>
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        Verification task
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        Additional information
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <b>
      Financial hardship arrangement check
     </b>
     <br/>
     Identifying and reviewing performance of formal financial hardship arrangements
    </td>
    <td>
     Where a borrower is experiencing difficulty paying their current commitments, they may enter into formal financial hardship arrangements with a credit or finance provider.  Poor conduct may occur even where such arrangements are in place.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     Identifying and reviewing performance of formal financial hardship arrangements applies to active commitments held by borrowers and / or income guarantors (WBC only) which are listed on the CCR bureau report.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     You are required to manually obtain and review the PDF version of the CCR bureau report to identify if the customer is specifically in temporary relief or has a deferral financial hardship arrangement in place
     <b>
      and
     </b>
     they are operating within the agreed arrangements.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     This check is not required where policy does not require a CCR to be generated. E.g. for a Servicing (Variation) activity where no CCR is required to be generated.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     The ‘financial hardship arrangement check’ policy applies to commitments held with both the Westpac Group or external
     <sup>
      1
     </sup>
     parties for each commitment type which appears on the CCR and tells us how to complete a financial hardship arrangement check.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     An application where a borrower and / or income guarantors are in temporary relief or a deferral financial hardship arrangement is in place
     <b>
      may
     </b>
     be referred to Credit for consideration if mitigants and additional supporting documents are provided. For example, details of the formal financial hardship arrangement.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     You can use the links below to navigate to the specific commitment type or scroll down the page to see the commitments listed in alphabetical order. Each commitment type will set out the requirements for verification.
     <ul>
      <li>
       <strong>
        Liability and Commitment Types
       </strong>
       <strong>
        :
       </strong>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <a href="#Liability &amp; Commitment Types - Refinance Permitted">
          Refinance permitted
         </a>
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="#Liability &amp; Commitment Types - Refinance not permitted">
          Refinance not permitted
         </a>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a data-tagid="2.5.1 Liabilities and Commitments exempt from financial hardship arrangement checks or conduct checks" href="#2.5.1 Liabilities and Commitments exempt from financial hardship arrangement checks or conduct checks">
        Liabilities and Commitments that are exempt from Financial Hardship Arrangement checks or Conduct checks
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       CCR Financial Hardship Arrangement criteria
      </li>
     </ul>
     ‘Evidence satisfactory repayment history’ is a separate verification activity. You must also comply with the associated rules below.
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        Evidence satisfactory repayment history
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       A review of historical account conduct forms a key component of the Westpac unsuitability assessment.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       Unsatisfactory conduct can be a sign an applicant is experiencing hardship in managing their current debt commitments.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       Verification of conduct applies to active commitments held by borrowers and/or income guarantors (WBC only).
       <br/>
       <br/>
       If the commitment has been operating for less than the specified time frame, conduct is to be assessed from the date the commitment was established.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       The 'Evidence satisfactory repayment history' check policy applies to commitments held with both the Westpac Group
       <strong>
        <span>
         or
        </span>
       </strong>
      </span>
      external parties
      <sup>
       1
      </sup>
      for each commitment type and tells us:
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         when and how to complete a repayment history check
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         what represents 'satisfactory' repayment history
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         the time period we need to review
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <span>
      <span>
       You will need to refer to the
       <a href="#R_Not_on_CCR_-_verifying_repayment_histo">
        'Not on CCR - Verifying repayment history when not using CCR'
       </a>
       rules where any of the below apply:
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         the commitment is not displayed on the CCR
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         repayment history demonstrated on CCR is blank
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          a commitment has recently been approved
          <b>
           but
          </b>
          is not yet open
          <b>
           or
          </b>
          has been open for less than 1 month
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         policy specifies that the 'Not on CCR' process / policy is to be followed
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         policy does not require a CCR to be generated
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <span>
      <span>
       You can use the links below to navigate to the specific commitment type or scroll down the page to see the commitments listed in alphabetical order. Each commitment type will set out the minimum requirements for verification and includes the minimum acceptable documents.
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <strong>
        Liability and Commitment Types
       </strong>
       <strong>
        :
       </strong>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <a href="#Liability &amp; Commitment Types - Refinance Permitted">
          Refinance permitted
         </a>
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="#Liability &amp; Commitment Types - Refinance not permitted">
          Refinance not permitted
         </a>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="#R_Liabilities_exempt_from_conduct_checks">
        <span>
         <span>
          Liabilities and Commitments exempt from financial hardship arrangement or conduct checks
         </span>
        </span>
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td colspan="2">
     <sup>
      <span>
       <span>
        1
       </span>
      </span>
     </sup>
     <span>
      <span>
       For the purpose of this policy, St George Bank Group and RAMS are considered to be external providers
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        Note
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
     <span>
      <span>
       : Post Unconditional Approval, account / Bpay details may need to be supplied if they aren't included in the documents used for verification of the commitment, in order to make the payment into any liabilities being cleared and closed or reduced using loan funds.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       Refinance is where some or all of the loan funds are being advanced to repay and refinance debts currently with Westpac (WBC), St George Bank Group and/or other financial institutions. This may involve a new loan or could include an increase on an existing loan to repay other debts, iI.e. where an existing debt is being:
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>

        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>

        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         Limit reduced
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>

       <br/>
       <br/>
       The variances are acceptable as they result in a more conservative monthly repayment amount being calculated for use within the serviceability assessment, or do not impact the calculated monthly repayment.

   <tr>
    <td rowspan="6">

     </span>

     <span>

     </span>
     <br/>

     <br/>
     <span>

      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       Credit Cards
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>

      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <span>

       Lease
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <span>

     </span>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>

     </span>

     </span>

       Term Loan

    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Limit
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         The supporting document evidences a lower limit than the value entered into the assessment system / used for the monthly repayment calculation
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Balance
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>

         The supporting document evidences a lower balance than the value entered into the application / used for the monthly repayment calculation or;
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         Applies only where limit is mandatory to be verified:
        </span>
       </span>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <span>
          <span>
           the supporting document evidences a higher balance than the value entered the application / used for the monthly repayment calculation.  The balance on supporting document must be less than or equal to the limit entered the assessment system / used for the monthly repayment calculation
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Interest rate
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         Applies where the commitment type has
         <strong>
          <span>
           not
          </span>
         </strong>
        </span>
        been negatively geared (e.g. no interest deduction has been applied for the specific debt to the serviceability calculation)
       </span>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <span>
          <span>
           The supporting document evidences a lower interest rate then the value entered the assessment system / used for the monthly repayment calculation
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       <strong>
        <span>
         <span>
          Does not apply
         </span>
        </span>
       </strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         where the commitment is a mortgage that has been negatively geared or where an interest deduction (for the specific debt) is being applied to the serviceability calculation.  Including when the commitment is a company commitment or a trust with corporate trustee.  In these scenarios the actual interest rate on the supporting document must be the same as the value entered in the assessment system to ensure we accurately reflect the negative gearing / interest deduction.
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>

        </span>

      </li>

 <h3>
  <a name="R_Time_Frame_/_Age_of_document_definitio">
   <strong>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.8 Time Frame / Age of document definition
     </span>
    </span>
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   When calculating if the document meets the required timeframe or age of document requirements the following definitions are to be used:
   <br/>
  </span>
 </span>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       The definition of 1 month is
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       The first day of the month up to and including the last day of the same month (e.g. 1/1/2018 to 31/1/2018)
       <br/>
       or
       <br/>
       Any day in the first month up to and including one day prior in the next month (e.g. 15/1/2018 to 14/2/2018)
       <br/>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       The definition of 2 months is
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       The first day of  month up to and including the last day of the following month (e.g. 1/1/2018 to 28/2/2018)
       <br/>
       or
       <br/>
       Any day in the first (given)  month up to and including one day prior in the following second month (e.g. 15/1/2018 to 14/3/2018)
       <br/>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td colspan="2">
     <span>
      <span>
       The same methodology may be extrapolated out to any higher number of months.
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <span>
  <span>
   <br/>
  </span>
 </span>

     3.1 Statutory Declarations

   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   Westpac Group staff are not to witness statutory declarations, when that declaration relates to a loan application or other Westpac loan variation activity. In these scenarios, a statutory declaration should be witnessed only by an authorised person as listed in the government website statutory declarations (excluding Westpac Group staff). This website includes links to information for each state. To enquire about statutory declarations in your state or territory, contact the relevant department below:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     New South Wales - Department of Justice
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     Northern Territory - Department of the Attorney-General and Justice
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     Queensland - Department of Justice and Attorney-General
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     South Australia - Attorney-General's Department
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     Tasmania - Department of Justice
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     Victoria - Department of Justice and Regulation
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     Western Australia - Department of the Attorney­ General.
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   Where the above websites allow a witness by a Westpac Group staff member, only witness the statutory declaration when it is not related to a Westpac Group loan application or loan variation activity.

 <h2>
  <a name="F_Frequently_asked_questions">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     4. Frequently asked questions
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="625">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        Question
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        Answer
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Are regular Chrisco payments (and other similar hamper scheme arrangements) to be captured as a living expense or a commitment?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Capture as an expense.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       Chrisco and other hamper schemes are like a lay-buy as you have to buy your goods before you get them and can cancel the order.
       <br/>
       In that way they are different from a credit card and buy now pay later schemes like AfterPay and ZipPay.
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       How do I know if a card needs to be repaid in full each month?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       If the minimum payment due is equal to the closing balance, the card must be paid in full.
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Are Layby payments to be captured as a living expense or a commitment?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Capture as an expense.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       They are different from a credit card and short term buy now pay later schemes as you have to pay for your goods in full before you receive them.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       Note: There is also a 'Buy Now Pay Later' facility name "Laybuy" which needs to be loaded as a commitment (not an expense).
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       When using an account statement for verification, do I need every page issued for that statement?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       No
       <br/>
       You only need the pages which:
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         Display the information you are verifying, and
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         Enable you to comply with the
         <em>
          <span>
           Minimum Document Standards
          </span>
         </em>
        </span>
        for an account statement
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       If a tax bill was due prior to the
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000698">
        Responsible Lending Start Date
       </a>
       , do I need to ask the customer if the bill was paid or provide evidence that it was paid?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       There is no requirement to make enquiries about or evidence payment of that bill, unless other application information suggests that the payment was not made (i.e the Tax bill has become a Tax debt)
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       My customer
       <strong>
        <span>
         pre-pays
        </span>
       </strong>
      </span>
      tax expected to be payable for the
      <strong>
       <span>
        current
       </span>
      </strong>
     </span>
     tax year. E.g. they make PAYG Instalments. Do I need to include this as a Tax Debt?
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       No. Pre-payment of tax is not considered to be a tax debt
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       The customer has advised that they don't have a tax bill or tax debt overdue. Do I need to undertake further enquiries or verification activity?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       There is no requirement to undertake further verification or evidence the current status of the customer's tax payments, unless other application information suggests that the payment was not made (i.e the Tax bill has become a Tax debt)
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Do I always need to get a statement to verify the details of the commitment and the repayment history of the account?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       No, you may use a combination of documents, provided the documents or systems used fulfil the policy requirements.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       For example, if policy requires that you verify :
       <br/>
       1) Loan Limit:
       <br/>
       2) Loan Interest Rate
       <br/>
       3) Loan Balance
       <br/>
       4) Repayment history
       <br/>
       <br/>
       If the Comprehensive Credit Report (CCR) provides the limit and repayment history only, a second document will be required to confirm the interest rate and the balance.  If the information you need (2 and 3) is contained on an 'account summary/extract/overview' (or any other allowable document), policy has been satisfied and an account statement (or any other document) is not required
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       What happens if a commitment has been closed, but the customer is still repaying the account?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       As an example this could occur where:
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         the customer has voluntarily cancelled a credit card but is still paying back the debt or
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         where the credit card has been revoked and limit cancelled by the card issuer due to poor conduct.
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <span>
      <span>
       You need to need to verify the details of the commitment and include the repayment for serviceability calculations.
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       I noticed that prior to this loan application the customer had been making payments to a credit card which has not been declared.
       <br/>
       The customer advised me that the card was closed prior to this loan application. The Comprehensive Credit Bureau Report (CCR) does not display the card as active, and I can't see any payments being made to the card after this loan application.
       <br/>
       Do I need the customer to provide evidence that the card has been closed?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       No.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       The customer has confirmed that the commitment was not in place at the time of the loan application and there is nothing to indicate a conflict with this information. As such, you may accept the customer's explanation and do not need to obtain evidence of closure.
       <br/>
       <br/>
       Ensure you record the details of your discussion in application comments.
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       How can the Bank  generate a refreshed Comprehensive Credit Bureau Report (CCR) to evidence that a commitment previously on the report is now closed or has been changed (e.g. the limit has been reduced)?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Automated system rules control when the CCR is refreshed. We are unable to refresh the CCR outside of these controls.  An alternate supporting document will be required to evidence the updated commitment position (closure, limit reduction etc.) if the CCR generated by the system does not reflect the closure/change
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       The Comprehensive Credit Bureau Report (CCR) shows an existing loan facility held jointly by the borrowers on the loan being processed.
       <br/>
       Do I have to load this existing loan against each borrower in ApplyOnline?
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       Yes.
       <br/>
       The existing loan commitment must be included in the serviceability assessment; this must be apportioned against all relevant borrowers.
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <br/>
</div>

 <h2>
  <a name="A__About_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       1. About this policy
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="A_Why_this_policy?">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       1.1 Why this policy?
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <table>
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      Purpose
     </b>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     A construction loan, also known as a building loan or a TBE (To-Be-Erected) loan, is a specialised lending option that provides a borrower and their builder, funding throughout the process of constructing or renovating a property.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     <br/>
     This policy identifies the structure required for a home loan where the borrowers would like to use the funds for residential building purposes.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     The loan proceeds can be used to fund the construction of one or more residential dwellings (subject to
     <em>
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000683">
      </a>
     </em>
     <span>
      <span>
       <em>
        <span>
         <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000682">
          Acceptable Security Collateral
         </a>
        </span>
       </em>
      </span>
     </span>
     ) or undertake home improvements (renovations) to an already established property, where the property is also security for the proposed loan.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     The main feature is the loan proceeds are paid in progressive payments to the builder during the construction phase. The frequency and percentage / amount of the progress payment being advanced can be affected by the type of security property and nature of the building contract.
     <br/>
     <br/>
     The construction can be completed by way of a Licensed Builder or an Owner Builder.
     <br/>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     Applicable to
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     Consumer mortgage applications where a borrower is seeking a new loan
     <br/>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <a>
      Policy exclusions
     </a>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     This policy does not apply to :
     <br/>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Bridging ICAP loan with no end debt
      </li>
      <li>
       Loan increase
      </li>
      <li>
       <strong>
        "Turn Key
       </strong>
       <strong>
        " House and Land Packages or Multi Unit Residential Developments
       </strong>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     Reading this policy
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     Unless specifically stipulated otherwise, the content applies to both non-mortgage insured (non-MI) and mortgage insured (MI) consumer mortgage loan applications
     <br/>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     Associated policies
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     You may also need to refer to other lending policy rules, including but not limited to:
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
           <em>
            <span>
             Loan to Value Ratio (LVR)
            </span>
           </em>
          </a>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000685">
        <em>
        </em>
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <em>
          <span>
           <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000682">
            Acceptable Security Collateral
           </a>
          </span>
         </em>
        </span>
       </span>
       <em>
        <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000683">
        </a>
       </em>
      </li>
      <li>
       If the application requires mortgage insurance, refer to:
       <ul>
        <li>
         <span>
          <span>
           <em>
            <span>
             <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000725">
              Lenders Mortgage Insurance
             </a>
            </span>
           </em>
          </span>
         </span>
         <em>
          <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000726">

      </li>

    </td>
