 <br/>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Serviceability_Assessment:_Changes_to_">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.13 Serviceability Assessment: Changes to financial circumstance
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    As part of our responsible lending obligations, it is required to ask the customer about potential changes to their financial position over the next three years that would adversely affect their ability to meet their financial obligations under the loan.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    Where such a change is expected, the customer is required to disclose:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   The nature of the change (see below)
  </li>
  <li>
   Their plans for continuing to meet the loan repayments (see below)
  </li>
 </ul>
 <strong>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     Nature of the change
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </strong>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The nature of change must be captured using the following declaration:
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1" width="681">
  <thead>
   <tr>
    <th>
     <h4 align="center">
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          Declaration question to customer
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </h4>
    </th>
   </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         Nature of Change
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Is extended unpaid leave (e.g. maternity) the nature of the expected change?
      </li>
      <li>
       Is end of contract/loss of employment the nature of the expected change?
      </li>
      <li>
       Is reduced income the nature of the expected change?
      </li>
      <li>
       Is retirement the nature of the expected change?
      </li>
      <li>
       Is leaving employment the nature of the expected change?
      </li>
      <li>
       Is medical treatment/illness the nature of the expected change?
      </li>
      <li>
       Is increase in debt repayments the nature of the expected change?
      </li>
      <li>
       Is large expenditure the nature of the expected change?
      </li>
      <li>
       Is the nature of the expected change none of the above, reflected here as Other?
      </li>
     </ul>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <br/>
        <strong>
         <span>
          Plans to meet loan repayments
         </span>
        </strong>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Will you continue to make repayments using savings?
      </li>
      <li>
       Does the information captured in the application already reflect the anticipated change?
      </li>
      <li>
       Will you continue to make repayments by securing additional income?
      </li>
      <li>
       Will you continue to make repayments by reducing expenditure?
      </li>
      <li>
       Will you continue to make repayments by the sale of other assets?
      </li>
      <li>
       Will you continue to make repayments by the sale of your principal residence?
      </li>
      <li>
       Will you continue to make repayments by other means?
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <br/>
 <strong>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     Approval
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </strong>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Applications require approval from a Credit (or other authorised CAL holder) where:
   <ul>
    <li>
     The customer advises that such a change is expected,
     <strong>
      <span>
       and
      </span>
     </strong>
    </li>
    <li>
     The application does not already reflect the change to the customer's financial situation (i.e. the application has not been assessed on the basis of the change)
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <ul>
  <li>
   All submissions to Credit for approval must include justification for the override request.
  </li>
 </ul>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Debt_To_Income_(DTI)_Ratio">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.14 Debt To Income (DTI) Ratio
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Loan assessment measure ‘Debt To Income Ratio’ assists Westpac Group to apply responsible lending practices in assessing a customer’s ability to service existing and proposed debts.
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_DTI_calculation">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.14.1 DTI Ratio Calculation
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <h4>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          Measure
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </h4>
    </td>
    <td>
     <h4>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          Definition
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </h4>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Debt
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Total of the higher of limit / balance of all borrower and Income Reliant Guarantor's new and existing liabilities excluding:
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Hire purchase, Leasing, Other Liabilities
      </li>
      <li>
       Any liabilities being cleared and closed in the submission, whether by customer or loan funds
      </li>
      <li>
       Bridging Loans (applies to new or existing, internal or external, IO or ICAP repayments)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Where a debt is being:
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          educed in the submission, whether by customer or loan funds, the New limit is used in lieu of the Current Limit for DTI calculation
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            <span>
             apportioned, the
             <b>
              entire
             </b>
             commitment value (higher of balance/limit)  is used in the DTI calculation (not the apportioned value)
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        e.g. Debt = $500,000
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Income
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Total gross unshaded annual income from borrower/s and
        <strong>
         <span>
          income guarantor
         </span>
        </strong>
        <span>
         (WBC only)
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       (including gross rental income and all other income types)
       <br/>
       <br/>
       e.g. Income= $65,000
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        DTI Ratio Calculation
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Debt ÷ Income
        <br/>
        <br/>
        e.g. $500,000 (Debt) ÷ $65,000 (Income)= 7.69 DTI ratio
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_DTI_Referral_to_Credit">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.14.2 High DTI Ratio - Commentary and Referral to Credit
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 OBP will return a DTI ratio Credit referral rule where:
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      the DTI ratio is equal to or greater than seven (7) and less than ten (10)
      <b>
       and:
      </b>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           the LVR is greater than 80%,
           <b>
            and/or
           </b>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           LMI applies
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         the DTI ratio is equal to or greater than ten (10).
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 In all instances where the DTI ratio is equal to or greater than seven (7), brokers/assessors must provide appropriate notes and comments in their submission to the effect that:
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        They have discussed the level of debt to income with the borrower(s) noting the debt level appears relatively high
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       They have identified any specific circumstances that are contributing to the high DTI result, such as other income not able to be included in the DTI calculation
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       Where any other policy rules have been triggered in addition to DTI, that valid mitigants can be demonstrated
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       They have validated the customers’ ability to meet repayments on the proposed loan noting the high DTI ratio
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       They have documented any other relevant rationale to support why the deal should still be approved
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <br/>
 Where the application triggers a Credit referral, Credit will review the application with consideration applied to:
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      the notes and comments in the submission
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           the LVR, level of monthly surplus, credit history (including anything adverse on their credit bureau) and level of income
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           any other policy exceptions or rules triggered
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
  <a id="2.15 Judgemental assessment" name="2.15 Judgemental assessment">
   <span>
    <span>
     <strong>
      <span>
       2.15 Judgemental assessment
      </span>
     </strong>
    </span>
   </span>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Some customers may exhibit circumstances where their financial situation needs to be considered as an exception by Credit ( or other authorised CAL holder ).
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
</div>

 <h2>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="A_About_this_policy">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      1.About this policy
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="A_Why_this_policy?">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      1.1 Why this policy?
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This policy will help you identify if the Westpac Group will waive Lenders’ Mortgage Insurance (LMI) for a consumer mortgage application where the applicant(s) meet the eligibility criteria.
    <br/>
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="R_Rules_you_must_apply">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      2. Rules you must apply
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h2>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <a name="R_Overview">
 </a>
 <strong>
  <span>
   2.1 Overview
  </span>
 </strong>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The policy outlined below sets out the parameters for accepting consumer mortgage proposals for:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         partners in certain qualifying Accounting and Law firms
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         senior executives (CEO and their direct reports) in ASX Top 100 companies
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <br/>
    The following allowable variances to standard consumer mortgage policy may be applied to eligible applicants, subject to meeting the conditions documented in this policy:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       Applications may be assessed to
       <strong>
        <span>
         a maximum
        </span>
       </strong>
       LVR of 90% without mortgage insurance, refer to
       <a href="#R_Special_conditions">
        Special conditions - LVR
       </a>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       Confirmation and verification of 5% genuine savings is not required for applications where mortgage insurance is not required.
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       Income and employment:
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <a data-tagid="R_Eligible_Partner" href="#R_Eligible_Partner">
          Partner
         </a>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <a data-tagid="R_Eligible_Senior_Executive" href="#R_Eligible_Senior_Executive">
          Senior Executive
         </a>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       <a data-tagid="R_Transfer_of_company_debt_to_personal_n" href="#R_Transfer_of_company_debt_to_personal_n">
        Transfer of company debt to personal names in the consumer portfolio
       </a>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <br/>
    All  other prevailing standard non-mortgage insured policies and product offerings for fully documented loans apply, including Interest Only repayment terms.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    Any lower LVR threshold policies will override this policy refer to
    <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
     Loan to Value Ratio (LVR)
    </a>
    , with the exception of LVR limits on property values – refer to
    <a href="#R_Special_conditions">
     Special conditions - LVR
    </a>
    .
    <br/>
    <br/>
    There is no authority to extend the approved package arrangement to other occupation types or products.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    This policy must be read in conjunction with the relevant policies contained in Consumer Mortgage Credit Policy Manual.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    <strong>
     <span>
      Note
     </span>
    </strong>
    : Approval is not guaranteed in line with the maximum offerings available under this policy.
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>

    <strong>
     <span>
      2.2.1 Income and Employment (Partner)
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h4>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       Specific income verification rules apply. Refer to
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000721">
        Income Verification
       </a>
       policy &gt; Self-employed Income &gt; Partners from selected companies. Partnership status is confirmed during income verification.
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       All income must be received in AUD. A lower LVR threshold applies when foreign income is used. Refer to
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
        Loan to Value Ratio (LVR)
       </a>
       &gt; LVR by borrower type and income source.
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>

    </a>

     <span>
      2.3 Eligible Senior Executive
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    To be eligible for this policy the broker / assessor
    <strong>
     <span>
      must confirm
     </span>
    </strong>
    that the applicant is the CEO, or direct report of the CEO, of one of the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX) Top 100 companies.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h4>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="R_Eligible_Senior_Executive_Income_and_E">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      2.3.1 Income and Employment (Senior Executive)
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h4>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       Employment is to be confirmed:
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         in writing by the company’s Human Resources department,
         <strong>
          <span>
           or
          </span>
         </strong>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         via board reports,
         <strong>
          <span>
           or
          </span>
         </strong>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         other information available from the ASX.
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       Standard income verification requirements to be applied, as per the
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000721">
        Verifying Income
       </a>
       policy.
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       All income must be received in AUD. A lower LVR threshold applies when foreign income is used. Refer to
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
        <span>
         Loan to Value Ratio (LVR)
        </span>
       </a>
       &gt; LVR by borrower type and income source.
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="R_Eligible_borrower_types_and_restrictio">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      2.4 Eligible applicant types and restrictions
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This policy is available for applications submitted for credit in the Partner / Senior Executive’s own name, or related company or trust entities provided direct ownership and / or directorship by the qualifying professional is evident.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    Lending or property ownership may be in the name of the spouse or related entity, provided the Partner / Senior Executive’s is involved in the transaction, at least as a guarantor.

  </span>

 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="R_Transfer_of_company_debt_to_personal_n">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      2.6 Transfer of company debt to personal names in the consumer portfolio
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    'Company' debts are defined as those used for purchase or construction of residential and / or business premises.
    <br/>
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <table>
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <h4>
      <span>
       <span>
        <strong>
         <span>
          Application type
         </span>
        </strong>
       </span>
      </span>
     </h4>
    </td>
    <td>
     <h4>
      <span>
       <span>
        <strong>
         <span>
          Allowable variance
         </span>
        </strong>
       </span>
      </span>
     </h4>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        If LMI
        <strong>
         <span>
          is not
         </span>
        </strong>
        required under this policy
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           Requests to transfer a facility to personal name(s) will be accommodated where it can be established that a personal debt was obtained in a company name with the outstanding debt appearing on the company's latest balance sheet, and the collateral security is held in personal name(s).
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           Refinance of business related lending purposes are specifically excluded.
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           Broker / assessor is to verify the authenticity of the original transaction and provide appropriate submission notes in the origination system.
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        If LMI
        <strong>
         <span>
          is not
         </span>
        </strong>
        required under this policy
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Standard policy applies - no allowable variance is available under this package offering
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>

 <h2>
  <a name="A_About_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       1. About this policy
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="A_Why_this_policy?">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       1.1 Why this policy?
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This policy will help you identify if the Westpac Group will waive Lenders’ Mortgage Insurance (LMI) for a consumer mortgage application where the applicant(s) meet the eligibility criteria.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <h2>
  <a name="R_Rules_you_must_apply">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2. Rules you must apply
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="R__Overview">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.1 Overview
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The policy outlined below sets out the parameters for consumer mortgage application proposals originated by Brokers for:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   eligible qualifying professionals within the Accounting and Law industries.
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The following allowable variances to standard policy may be applied to eligible applicants, subject to meeting the conditions documented in this policy:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Applications may be assessed to
   <strong>
    <span>
     a maximum
    </span>
   </strong>
   LVR of 90%* without mortgage insurance - refer
   <a href="#2.4 Special conditions - LVR">
    Special conditions - LVR
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   Confirmation and verification of 5% genuine savings is not required for applications where mortgage insurance is not required
  </li>
  <li>
   <a href="#R_Practice_premises_offered_as_security_">
    <em>
     Practice premises offered as security collateral
    </em>
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   <a href="#R_Transfer_of_company_debt_to_personal_n">
    <em>
     Transfer of company debt to personal names in the consumer portfolio
    </em>
   </a>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    All other standard non-mortgage insured policies and product offerings for fully documented loans apply, including Interest Only repayment terms.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    Any lower LVR threshold policies will override this policy including LVR limits on property value. Refer to
    <em>
     <span>
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
       Loan to Value Ratio (LVR)
      </a>
      .
     </span>
    </em>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   Credit exceptions are not available for any occupations types not listed in
   <a href="#R__Eligiblity_criteria">
    Eligibility Criteria
   </a>
   .
   <br/>
   <br/>
   <strong>
    Note:
   </strong>
   Approval is not guaranteed in line with the maximum offerings available under this policy.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <h3>
  <br/>
  <a name="R__Eligiblity_criteria">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.2 Eligibility criteria
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 The below policy relating to income and employment  are applicable where LMI is eligible to be waived.
 <br/>
 Where LMI is required,  standard  verification requirements are  to be applied.
 <br/>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_Eligible_occupations,_qualifications,_">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.2.1 Eligible occupations, qualifications, employment
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 The applicant must:
 <ul>
  <li>
   be employed directly within the industry; and
  </li>
  <li>
   be obtaining an income from their qualification; and
  </li>
  <li>
   meet the qualifying occupation, employment criteria and policy (as outlined in the table below)
  </li>
 </ul>
 <br/>
 The broker must obtain confirmation of the applicant’s qualifications and employment, with a copy of the evidencing document or search retained in the loan application.

 </span>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_Eligible_borrower_types_and_restrictio">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.2.2 Eligible applicant types and restrictions
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 This policy is available for applications submitted for credit in the qualifying professional’s own name, or related company or trust entities provided direct ownership and/or directorship by the qualifying professional is evident. Lending or property ownership may be in the name of the spouse or related entity, provided the qualifying professional is involved in the transaction, at least as a guarantor.
 <br/>
 <br/>
 Applicants must be:
 <ul>
  <li>
   Australian citizens, or
  </li>
  <li>
   approved permanent visa holders (refer
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000702">
    <em>
     <span>
      Lending to Non-Australian Citizens
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
   ), or
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       approved temporary visa holders that are acceptable to the Bank
       <b>
        and
       </b>
       the Mortgage Insurer (
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
   refer
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000702">
    <em>
     <span>
      Lending to Non-Australian Citizens
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       )
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 Residency, citizenship and VISA status must be verified at the time the loan application is submitted.
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Refer to the following policies,
    <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000702">
     Lending to Non-Australian Citizens
    </a>
    &gt; Visa matrix &gt; Acceptable Visas and
    <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000694">
     Eligibility
    </a>
    &gt; Eligible Borrowers).
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_Income_threshold_eligibility">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.2.3 Income threshold eligibility
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 The qualifying professionals’ gross taxable income must be a minimum of $120,000 per annum.
 <br/>
 If the application contains multiple qualifying professionals, the combined minimum gross taxable income of $120,000 per annum must be met.
 <br/>
 <span>
  Income from other sources e.g. rental income, may be used for serviceability assessment but cannot be used to meet minimum threshold of $120,000.
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Income_verification">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.3 Income verification
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 For PAYG and self-employed applicants, standard income and employment verification is required to be undertaken as per normal policy requirements. Refer to
 <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000721">
  <em>
   Verifying Income
  </em>
 </a>
 or
 <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000708">
  <em>
   Self-employed applicants
  </em>
 </a>
 policy for further details.
 <br/>
 <br/>
 All income must be received in AUD. Lower LVR threshold applies when foreign income is used. Refer to
 <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
  Loan to Value Ratio
 </a>
 policy for further details.
 <br/>

 <h2>
  <a name="A_About_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      1. About this policy
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="A_Why_this_policy?">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      1.1 Why this policy?
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This policy will help you identify if the Westpac Group will waive Lenders’ Mortgage Insurance (LMI) for a consumer mortgage application where the applicant(s) meet the eligibility criteria
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    .
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <a name="R_Rules_you_must_apply">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2. Rules you must apply
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Overview">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.1 Overview
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The following allowable variances to standard consumer mortgage policy may be applied to eligible applicants, subject to meeting the conditions documented in this policy:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   May be assessed to
   <strong>
    <span>
     a maximum
    </span>
   </strong>
   LVR of 90% of without mortgage insurance - refer to
   <em>
    <a href="#R_Special_conditions">
     Special conditions - LVR
    </a>
   </em>
  </li>
  <li>
   Confirmation and verification of 5% genuine savings is not required for applications whereby mortgage insurance is not required (as per above)
  </li>
  <li>
   <em>
    <a href="#R_Income_verification">
     Income verification
    </a>
   </em>
  </li>
  <li>
   <a href="#R_Practice_premises_offered_as_security_">
    <em>
     Practice premises offered as security collateral
    </em>
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   <a href="#R_Transfer_of_company_debt_to_personal_n">
    <em>
     Transfer of company debt to personal names in the consumer portfolio
    </em>
   </a>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    All other standard non-mortgage insured policies and product offerings for fully documented loans apply, including Interest Only repayment terms.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    Any lower LVR threshold policies will override this policy, refer to
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <em>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
      Loan to Value Ratio (LVR)
     </a>
     ,
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </em>
 except LVR limits on property value refer to
 <a href="#R_Special_conditions">
  <em>
   Special Conditions - LVR
  </em>
 </a>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    No credit exceptions are available for any occupation types not listed under
    <a href="#R_Eligibility_criteria">
     <em>
      Eligiblity Criteria
     </em>
    </a>
    <br/>
    <br/>
    This policy must be read in conjunction with the policies contained in the Consumer Mortgage Credit Policy.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <strong>
  Note:
 </strong>
 Approval is not guaranteed in line with the maximum offerings available under this policy
 <br/>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Eligibility_criteria">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.2 Eligibility criteria
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 The below eligibility rules  relating to income, employment and LVR are applicable where LMI is eligible to be waived.
 <br/>
 Where LMI is required, the usual policy including standard income verification requirements is to be applied.

 <h4>
  <a name="R_Qualification_and_employment">
  </a>
  <span>
   <strong>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.2.2 Qualification and employment
     </span>
    </span>
   </strong>
  </span>
 </h4>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Confirmation must be obtained of the applicant’s qualifications and employment as an eligible medical professional via one of the following:
  </li>
 </ul>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Most recent Australian income tax return
        <strong>
         <span>
          or
         </span>
        </strong>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Copy of Australian university degree or qualification,
        <strong>
         <span>
          or
         </span>
        </strong>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Copy of registration with the Medical Practitioners Board of Australia or equivalent body (copy of print out from the following web page is acceptable provided the registration is current
        <a href="http://www.ahpra.gov.au/Registration/Registers-of-Practitioners.aspx">
         <em>
          <span>
           http://www.ahpra.gov.au/Registration/Registers-of-Practitioners.aspx
          </span>
         </em>
        </a>
        ).
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <div>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     A Sonographer, Speech pathologist and Audiologist do not require registration with AHPRA.
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </div>
 <ul>
 </ul>
 <div>
  <div>
   <div id="_com_1" language="JavaScript">
    <ul>
     <li>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>

          <a href="https://www.asar.com.au/sonographer-info/find-a-sonographer/">
           https://www.asar.com.au/sonographer-info/find-a-sonographer/
          </a>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </li>
     <li>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>

           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>

      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>

            </a>
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </li>
    </ul>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       The applicant must be obtaining an income from their medical qualification. A qualified medical professional working in medical research can be considered under this policy if the research field is the same as their area of medical qualification.
       <br/>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>

 <h4>
  <a name="R_Eligible_borrower_types_and_restrictio">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.2.3 Eligible applicant types and restrictions
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 <ul>
  <li>
   This policy is available for applications submitted for credit in the medico's own name, or related company or trust entities provided direct ownership and/or directorship by the medico is evident. Residential mortgage lending or property ownership may be in the name of the spouse or related entity, provided the medico is involved in the transaction, at least as a guarantor
  </li>
  <li>
   Applicants must be:
   <ul>
    <li>
     Australian citizens, or
    </li>
    <li>
     approved permanent  visa holders (refer
     <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000702">
      <em>
       Lending to Non-Australian Citizens
      </em>
     </a>
     ), or
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        approved temporary visa holders that are acceptable to the Bank
        <b>
         and
        </b>
        the Mortgage Insurer (
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     refer
     <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000702">
      <em>
       Lending to Non-Australian Citizens
      </em>
     </a>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        policy)
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   Residency, citizenship and VISA status must be verified at the time of submission of the loan application.
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      (refer to the following policies,
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000702">
       Lending to Non-Australian Citizens
      </a>
      &gt; Visa matrix &gt; Acceptable Visas and
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000694">
       Eligibility
      </a>
      &gt; Eligible Borrowers).
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>

 <h2>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     <a name="A_About_this_policy">
     </a>
     <strong>

      </span>

 </h2>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     <a name="A_Why_this_policy?">
     </a>
     <strong>
      <span>
       1.1 Why this policy?
      </span>
     </strong>
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This policy will help you identify if the Westpac Group will waive Lenders’ Mortgage Insurance (LMI) for a consumer mortgage application where the applicant(s) meet the eligibility criteria.
    <br/>
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     <a name="R_Rules_you_must_apply">
     </a>
     <strong>
      <span>
       2. Rules you must apply
      </span>
     </strong>
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     <a name="R_Staff_home_loan_benefits">
     </a>
     <strong>
      <span>
       2.1 Employee (Staff) and Contractor home loan benefits
      </span>
     </strong>
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The Bank offers a range of benefits, designed to position employees and contractors as priority customers.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <b>
     Eligibility
    </b>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Home Loans with Westpac, St George, Bank of Melbourne and BankSA only (excludes RAMS).
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Must be a current permanent employee or contractor. Ex-employees are not eligible for this offer.
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Must be a packaged home loan.
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Not available to company and trust account holders.
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Must be Standard Variable Rate or Fixed Rate loan product (excludes Portfolio, Basic, SMSF loans etc.).
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      No minimum loan size required.
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <br/>
    The following allowable variances to standard Consumer mortgage policy may be applied to eligible borrowers, subject to meeting the conditions documented in this policy :
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       Applications may be assessed to a maximum LVR of 90% without mortgage insurance. Refer to
       <a data-tagid="R_Lenders_mortgage_insurance_exemption_c" href="#R_Lenders_mortgage_insurance_exemption_c">
        Lenders Mortgage insurance exemption criteria
       </a>
       table &gt; LVR
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    All other standard non-mortgage insured policies and product offerings for fully documented applications apply, including Interest Only repayment terms.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    This policy must be read in conjunction with the policies and processes contained within the Credit Policy Manual and relates specifically to LMI exemption for eligible employees and contractors. This offer is not available in conjunction with any other special offers, or other packages offered by The Westpac Group.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    <strong>
     <span>
      Note
     </span>
    </strong>
    : Approval is not guaranteed in line with the maximum offerings available under this policy.
    <br/>
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <span>
     <a name="R_Lenders_mortgage_insurance_exemption_c">
     </a>
     <strong>
      <span>
       2.2 Lenders mortgage insurance exemption criteria
      </span>
     </strong>
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Eligible employees and contractors will be exempt from Lender's Mortgage Insurance (LMI), where the below LMI exemption criteria are met.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    Credit is subject to the Bank's normal lending criteria.
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <table width="628">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <h4>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <strong>
          <span>
           Feature
          </span>
         </strong>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </h4>
    </td>
    <td colspan="2">
     <h4>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         <strong>
          <span>
           LMI exemption criteria
          </span>
         </strong>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </h4>
    </td>
   </tr>

 <h2>
  <a name="A_About_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      1. About this policy
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="A_Why_this_policy?">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      1.1 Why this policy?
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This policy will help you identify if the Westpac Group will waive Lenders’ Mortgage Insurance (LMI) for a consumer mortgage application where the applicant(s) meet the eligibility criteria.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <u>
     This package offering only applies to WBC brand and is not available to SGB / BoM / BSA
    </u>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <a name="R_Rules_you_must_apply">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2. Rules you must apply
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Overview">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.1 Overview
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The policy outlined below sets out the parameters for accepting consumer mortgage proposals originated by Brokers for:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   eligible Professional Sports and Entertainment persons.
   <br/>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The following allowable variances to standard policy may be applied to eligible applicants, subject to meeting the conditions documented in this policy:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Applications may be assessed to
   <strong>
    <span>
     a maximum
    </span>
   </strong>
   LVR of 90% without mortgage insurance - refer to
   <a href="#R_Special_conditions">
    <em>
     Special conditions - LVR
    </em>
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   Confirmation and verification of 5% genuine savings is not required for applications where mortgage insurance is not required.
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    All  other standard non-mortgage insured policies and product offerings for fully documented applications apply, including Interest Only repayment terms.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    Any lower LVR threshold policies will override this policy, including LVR limits on property values - refer to
   </span>
   <em>
    <span>
     <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
      Loan to Value Ratio (LVR)
     </a>
     .
    </span>
   </em>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    There is no authority to extend the approved package arrangement to other occupation types or products.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    This policy must be read in conjunction with the policies and procedures contained in other sections of the Consumer Mortgage Credit Policy Manual.
    <br/>
    <br/>
    <strong>
     Note:
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 Approval is not guaranteed in line with the maximum offerings available under this policy.
 <br/>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Eligibility_criteria">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.2 Eligibility criteria
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The target applicants must meet the Westpac Premium or Private Bank criteria or have the potential to meet the criteria within the near future.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Given the levels of criteria set from the outset, the Sector Policy will be most relevant to talent in their prime or high potential talent who have been identified as the stars of the future.
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_Eligible_Sports_person">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.2.1 Eligible Sports person
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 <ul>
  <li>
   For the purpose of this policy,
   <strong>
    <span>
     eligible sports persons
    </span>
   </strong>
   include the following:
   <ul>
    <li>
     Professional athlete (all sports);
    </li>
    <li>
     Professional coach (all sports);
    </li>
    <li>
     Retired athlete still working within the sports or entertainment industry
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   To be classified as a Professional Sport and Entertainment Person, the talent must have an accredited Manager, Agent or Accountant. The responsibility for confirmation of this rests with the originating Broker
  </li>
 </ul>

   This policy is available for applications submitted for credit in the applicant’s own name, or related company or trust entities provided direct ownership and / or directorship by the applicant is evident. Residential mortgage lending or property ownership may be in the name of the spouse or related entity, provided the applicant is involved in the transaction, at least as a guarantor.
  </li>

   Applicants must be:

     Australian citizens; or
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         approved permanent visa holders (refer
         <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000702">

         policy), or

         <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000702">

       Loans up to 90% with $750,000 to $2,000,000 secured WBC/SGB/BoM/BSA exposure from loans with LVR greater than 80% without LMI) will require appropriate PAII (or income protection insurance) to be taken out in order for an MI waiver to be applied. Brokers must provide evidence of this within the submission
      </li>
      <li>
       For LVRs higher than the above levels, or where the customer elects to pay mortgage insurance, applications will be subject to acceptance in terms of standard bank and
       <span>
       </span>
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000725" role="link" target="_blank">
        Lender’s Mortgage Insurance
       </a>
       <span>
       </span>
       policy(s)
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>

 <h2>
  <a name="A_About_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       1. About this policy
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="A_Why_this_policy?">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       1.1 Why this policy?
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 The purpose of this policy is to provide an overview of the following requirements for the consumer mortgage application:
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     genuine savings
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      customer contribution and funds to complete the loan transaction.
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    If the loan application requires mortgage insurance, refer to
   </span>
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000725">
    <em>
     <span>
      Lenders Mortgage Insurance
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
  </span>
  <em>
   <span>
    <span>
     ,
    </span>
   </span>
  </em>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    where required.
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <a name="R_Rules_you_must_apply">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2. Rules you must apply
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Genuine_savings">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.1 Genuine savings
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Demonstrated genuine savings behaviour provides evidence of the borrower’s capacity to service the consumer mortgage loan application requested as well as a proven ability to meet regular commitments.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    5% genuine savings must be verified on all consumer mortgage insured applications where the base LVR exceeds 90%.
    <br/>
    Verification can be via either:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <a href="#R_Acceptable_'Tier_1'_sources_of_genuine">
    <em>
     <span>
      Acceptable ‘Tier 1’ sources
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   <a href="#R_Acceptable_'Tier_2'_sources_of_genuine">
    <em>
     <span>
      Acceptable ‘Tier 2’ sources
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Evidence of genuine savings is to be retained on the file, refer to
    <a href="#R_Recording_evidence_of_genuine_savings,">
     <em>
      <span>
       Recording evidence of genuine savings
      </span>
     </em>
    </a>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   .
   <br/>
   Also refer to
   <a href="#R_Unacceptable_sources_of_genuine_saving">
    <em>
     <span>
      Unacceptable sources of genuine savings
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   <em>
    <span>
     .
    </span>
   </em>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
 </h3>

     <span>

     </span>

 </h4>
 In order to use the 'Tier 2' sources of genuine savings, the
 <a href="#R_Eligibility_for_'Tier_2'_sources_of_ge">
  <em>
   'Tier 2' eligibility policy
  </em>
 </a>
 (prior section) must be met.
 <br/>
 <br/>
 The below 'Tier 2' sources may be used singularly or in combination and:
 <ul>
  <li>
   must have been accumulated over or held for less than 3 months otherwise  they are to be assessed as
   <a href="#R_Eligibility_for_'Tier_2'_sources_of_ge">
    <em>
     'Tier 1' sources
    </em>
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   if combined, the total amounts verified must be a minimum of the required 5%
  </li>
  <li>
   must be evident at the Responsible Lending Start Date
  </li>
  <li>
   verification documents must comply with
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000692">
    <em>

     </ul>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Nature of payment
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Australian Tax Office Notice of Assessment detailing the amount of refund due
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Payment amount ($)
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Account statement;
       <strong>
        <span>
         or
        </span>
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       Account transaction listing
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_Unacceptable_sources_of_genuine_saving">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.1.5 Unacceptable sources of genuine savings
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1" width="628">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Unacceptable sources of genuine savings
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        Bonus / Dividend / Commission received in a foreign currency
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       Borrowed funds / deposits (proceeds from personal loans or other borrowings)
      </li>
      <li>
       Builder’s incentives rebate
      </li>
      <li>
       Compensation payout proceeds
      </li>
      <li>
       Cash holdings
      </li>
      <li>
       Favourable purchase (not arm’s length)
      </li>
      <li>
       FHOG (First Home Owners Grant) or any State Government assistance
      </li>
      <li>
       Funds held in a business / company account
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        Funds held in a foreign bank account
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       Gift (of any kind) proceeds
      </li>
      <li>
       Livestock sale proceeds
      </li>
      <li>
       Vendor savings plans
      </li>
      <li>
       Windfall proceeds e.g. lottery
      </li>
      <li>
       Bank statements showing bulk deposits held for less than 3 months (if Tier 1 source)
      </li>
      <li>
       Promissory notes / letters
      </li>
      <li>
       Incentives for early completion
      </li>
      <li>
       Marketing / cash back offers
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Verifying_10%_equity_requirement_for_I">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.2 Verifying 10% equity requirement for Investment Loans
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Any Mortgage insured consumer mortgage application for investment loans that have a Total LVR &gt;90% (inclusive of LMI premium) will require a minimum equity of 10% to be held in already owned property in Australia.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The 10% equity must be:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      maintained post drawdown of the requested loan
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      not eroded through equity release or LMI premium capitalisation to assist with the completion of the requested loan.
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Documents used to verify 10% equity must comply with
    <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000692">
     <em>
      <span>
       Document Standards
      </span>
     </em>
    </a>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   .
   <br/>
  </span>
 </span>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1" width="628">
  <thead>
   <tr>
    <th>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Confirm
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </th>
    <th>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Verify by
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </th>
   </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Property ownership
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Australian property must only be owned by one or more borrower
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Title search
       <strong>
        <span>
         or
        </span>
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       Council rates notice
       <strong>
        <span>
         or
        </span>
       </strong>
      </li>
      <li>
       Utility Bill
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Property value
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Use customer's estimated market value
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Limit of existing debt (if any) against the property
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Documents as obtained through normal consumer mortgage loan assessment - Refer
       </span>
       <em>
        <span>
         <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000690">
          Commitments
         </a>
         policy
        </span>
       </em>
      </span>
      <span>
       <em>
        <span>
         &gt; Confirm details of the commitment
        </span>
       </em>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Amount of equity in the property
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Calculation required:
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       property value minus any existing debt limit
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Customer_contribution">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.3 Customer contribution
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The customer contribution is the amount the borrower will need to pay to cover the difference between the purchase price (or construction cost or refinance cost) plus legal, mortgage insurance, stamp duty, and other fees, less the loan amount.
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_Evidencing_customer_contribution">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.3.1 Evidencing customer contribution
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The customer contribution must be:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   available at the time of formal application, or comply with the policy detailed under
   <a href="#R_Shortfall_in_customer_contribution">
    <em>
     <span>
      Shortfall in customer contribution
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   shown in the statement of assets and liabilities
  </li>
  <li>
   clearly indicated in the funding table
  </li>
  <li>
   compliant with
   <em>
    <span>
     AML reporting
    </span>
   </em>
   requirements
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    If a low valuation reduces the available loan amount and increases the contribution amount, ensure:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   the customer contribution is still sufficient
  </li>
  <li>
   submission notes and funding table details are updated
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_Acceptable_sources_of_customer_contrib">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.3.2 Acceptable sources of customer contributions
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Also refer to
    <a href="#R_Unacceptable_sources_of_customer_contr">
     <em>
      <span>
       Unacceptable sources of customer contribution
      </span>
     </em>
    </a>
   </span>
   for further details
  </span>
 </span>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1" width="628">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Application Type
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Acceptable Sources
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Mortgage insured loans
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Once any genuine savings required has been verified, any additional customer contribution required may be from:
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Accessible superannuation, provided the borrower has met Australian Taxation Office and Superannuation Industry (Supervision) Act requirements, e.g. borrower is able to access a lump sum from their superannuation due to:
       <ul>
        <li>
         Reached preservation age
        </li>
        <li>
         Under transition to retirement rules, while continuing work
        </li>
        <li>
         First Home Buyer Super Saver Scheme
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       Bonus / commissions / dividends
      </li>
      <li>
       Cash holdings
      </li>
      <li>
       Compensation payouts (standard income verification requirements apply and ability for the borrower to meet standard employment and serviceability policy)
      </li>
      <li>
       First Home Owners Grant
      </li>
      <li>
       Gifts
      </li>
      <li>
       Inheritance
      </li>
      <li>
       Personal savings account
      </li>
      <li>
       Real estate equity (with any liability and loan repayment reflected in the consumer mortgage application)
      </li>
      <li>
       Sale of asset
      </li>
      <li>
       Sale of stocks / shares publicly listed in the borrower’s name
      </li>
      <li>
       Tax refund
      </li>
      <li>
       Term Deposit account
      </li>
      <li>
       Windfall
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Non-mortgage insured loans
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        In addition to the sources listed as acceptable under 'Mortgage insured loans', customer contribution may be from:
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       A source not listed under
       <a href="#R_Unacceptable_sources_of_customer_contr">
        <em>
         <span>
          Unacceptable sources of customer contribution
         </span>
        </em>
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       Loan from family or friends (with the liability and loan repayment reflected in the consumer mortgage application)
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_Unacceptable_sources_of_customer_contr">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.3.3 Unacceptable sources of customer contribution
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1" width="628">
  <thead>
   <tr>
    <th>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
         Unacceptable sources (for both non-mortgage insured and mortgage insured loans)
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </th>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <th>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Purchase or builder’s rebates either before or after purchase settlement
      </li>
      <li>
       Incentives for early completion
      </li>
      <li>
       Marketing / cash back offers
      </li>
      <li>
       Promissory notes / letters
      </li>
      <li>
       Vendor savings plans (can only be accepted by Credit as an exception – non-mortgage insured transactions only)
      </li>
      <li>
       Loans from sources not specifically listed as 'acceptable' e.g. an unsecured personal loan from a financial institution (even if the liability and loan repayment are to be shown in the application)
      </li>
     </ul>
    </th>
   </tr>
  </thead>
 </table>
 <h4>
  <a name="R_Shortfall_in_customer_contribution">

  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <span>
       2.3.4 Shortfall in customer contribution
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h4>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    If at the time of assessment, a shortfall in customer contribution is apparent, the consumer mortgage application may proceed where:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   the shortfall can realistically be saved within the below generally accepted period allowed for settlement
  </li>
  <li>
   the saving of the shortfall is consistent with the borrower/s current savings pattern
  </li>
  <li>
   Credit approval is held for any shortfall &gt;$2,000
  </li>
 </ul>

 <h2>
  <a name="A_About_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     1. About this policy
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <h3>
 </h3>
 <h3>
  <a id="1.1 Why this policy?" name="1.1 Why this policy?">
   <strong>
    1.1 Why this policy?
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <table>
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      Purpose
     </b>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     Identifies acceptable sources of income and their associated:
     <ul>
      <li>
       assessment values
      </li>
      <li>
       conditions
      </li>
      <li>
       verification methods
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      Applicable to
     </b>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     <ul>
      <li>
       Consumer mortgage applications where a borrower is seeking any of:
       <ul>
        <li>
         new loan
        </li>
        <li>
         loan increase
        </li>
        <li>
         servicing / variation activity requiring a serviceability assessment
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      E
     </b>
     <b>
      xclusions
     </b>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     This policy
     <b>
      does not apply
     </b>
     to a Bridging ICAP loan with no end debt
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      Reading this policy
     </b>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     Unless specifically stipulated otherwise, the content applies to both non-mortgage insured (non-MI) and mortgage insured (MI) consumer mortgage loan applications
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      Associated policies
     </b>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     You may also need to refer to other lending policy rules, including but not limited to:
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000710">
        <em>
         Serviceability Assessment
        </em>
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000692">
        <em>
         Document Standards
        </em>
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000708">
        <i>
         Self-employed applicants
        </i>
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000714">
        <i>
         Special Packages - Medico Sector
        </i>
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000698">
        <i>
         Loan Application and Approval &gt; Validation of information provided by the customer
        </i>
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <u>
        If the application requires mortgage insurance, where required refer to:
       </u>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000725">
          Lenders Mortgage Insurance
         </a>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
 <h3>
  <a id="1.2 Unacceptable Income" name="1.2 Unacceptable Income">
   <strong>
    1.2 Unacceptable Income
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <strong>
  If the income is not listed, then it is unacceptable
 </strong>
 . Income not listed may be considered by Credit where:
 <ul>
  <li>
   appropriate mitigants to accept have been provided; and
  </li>
  <li>
   evidence of the income can be obtained to complete verification
   <br/>
   Credit will determine how the verification is to take place and the income calculation to be used.
   <br/>
   <br/>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
  <a id="1.3 Income not used for servicing" name="1.3 Income not used for servicing">
   1.3 Income not used for servicing
  </a>
 </h3>
 Applicants
 <b>
  are not
 </b>
 required to provide evidence of income where it is not used to service the loan, unless:
 <ul>
  <li>
   required for self-employed applicants as detailed under ‘Self-employed income, Directorships, company shareholding, ABN’
   <strong>
    or
   </strong>
  </li>
  <li>
   specifically requested by Credit on a case-by-case basis
   <br/>
   <b>
    Action required:
   </b>
   <br/>
   Where any income type is evident on a verification document but is not used, notes must be entered to explain why this is the case.
   <br/>
   For PAYG Salary or Wage income, this includes using a lower base income figure and not using non-base income.
   <br/>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h3>
  <a id="1.4 Self-employed income, Directorships, company shareholding, ABN" name="1.4 Self-employed income, Directorships, company shareholding, ABN">
   1.4 Self-employed income, Directorships, company shareholding, ABN
  </a>
 </h3>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Self-employed income (including Trust distribution and company income / profitability) is required to be verified in conjunction with
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000708">
    <i>
     Self Employed Applicants
    </i>
   </a>
   policy
  </li>
  <li>
   Where the borrower, income guarantor (WBC only) or borrower’s spouse (where using the apportioned household expense policy) has a directorship(s), shareholding or an ABN, as identified via Credit Bureau Reporting or other application checks, and the applicant is not being assessed under Fast Track, Brokers/ Assessors are required to undertake further investigation to identify if they must be assessed as self-employed. Refer to the
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000708">
    Self-employed Applicants
   </a>
   policy
  </li>
 </ul>

     </b>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     Refer to ‘
     <a data-tagid="Family Employee" href="#Family Employee">
      Family Employee
     </a>
     ’
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      If Full time or Part Time:
     </b>
     <ul>
      <li>
       As per ‘Full Time or Part Time’
      </li>
     </ul>
     <b>
     </b>
     <br/>
     <b>
      If Casual:
     </b>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Minimum 6 months continuous service with the same employer
      </li>
     </ul>
     <b>
     </b>
     <br/>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      If Full time or Part Time:
     </b>
     <ul>
      <li>
       As per ‘Full Time or Part Time’
      </li>
     </ul>
     <br/>
     <b>
      If Casual:
     </b>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Minimum 6 months continuous service with the same employer,
       <b>
        and
       </b>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <ul>
      <li>
       12 months minimum employment history (inclusive of the current employment) with no greater than a 1 month gap between current and previous job (does not have to be in the same role)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <br/>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      Full Time or  Part Time employment
     </b>
     <br/>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      Full time:
     </b>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Usually 32 hours or more of work per week
      </li>
      <li>
       Work is regular and ongoing
      </li>
     </ul>
     <br/>
     <b>
      Part time:
     </b>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Usually less than 32 hours of work per week
      </li>
      <li>
       Work is regular and ongoing.  The weekly hours worked would vary little or not at all.
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     No minimum
     <br/>
     <br/>
     <br/>
     <br/>
     <br/>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     3 months minimum length in current employment
     <br/>
     <br/>
     If less than 3 months in current employment must have a record of total employment history in the same occupation of at least 12 months, with a maximum 2-month gap between positions.
     <br/>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      Second employment (Full, Part-time (Multiple Permanent Jobs), Casual)
     </b>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     More than one employment source
     <br/>
     <br/>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     As per associated employment listed in this table
     <br/>
     <br/>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     <ul>
      <li>
       <u>
        Primary employment
       </u>
       – as per associated employment type listed in this table;
       <b>
        and
       </b>
      </li>
      <li>
       <u>
        Secondary employment
       </u>
       - Minimum 1 year in current secondary employment
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td valign="top">
     <b>
      Temporary employment
     </b>
     <br/>
     <br/>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     Refer to ‘
     <a data-tagid="Temporary Employment (AUD)" href="#Temporary Employment (AUD)">
      Temporary Employment
     </a>
     ’
     <br/>
     The definition instructs whether to assess as a:
     <ul>
      <li>
       Dependant contractor, or
      </li>
      <li>
       Casual
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
    <td colspan="2" valign="top">
     <b>
      If assessed as:
     </b>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <b>
        Dependant Contractor:
       </b>
       <ul>
        <li>
         As per ‘
         <a data-tagid="Dependent Contractor (AUD)" href="#Dependent Contractor (AUD)">
          Dependant contractor
         </a>
         ’
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <b>
        Casual:
       </b>
       <ul>
        <li>
         As per ‘
         <a data-tagid="Casual Income (AUD)" href="#Casual Income (AUD)">
          Casual
         </a>
         ’
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </tbody>
 </table>
