 <h3>
  <a name="R_Requests_for__premium_refunds">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      2.5 Requests for premium refunds
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Cancellation of the policy and appropriate premium refund will be requested
    <strong>
     <span>
      only
     </span>
    </strong>
    where the below conditions are met. The refund process will commence automatically, once the Bank notifies the Mortgage Insurer that the loan has been paid in full and the mortgage discharged.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The decision to refund a premium is at the discretion of the Insurer.. The Bank makes no decision about whether or not a refund is due.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1">
  <tbody>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        Scenario
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
    <td>
     <strong>
      <span>
       <span>
        Conditions
       </span>
      </span>
     </strong>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       For proposals which proceed
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <ul>
      <li>
       The loan has been paid and discharged in full, and
      </li>
      <li>
       Within the first two years of the policy commencement, and
      </li>
      <li>
       The loan has not been reported to have arrears, and
      </li>
      <li>
       The loan is not in Collections, and
      </li>
      <li>
       The loan is not subject to a claim, and
      </li>
      <li>
       There are no additional loans still outstanding covered under the original LMI policy, and
      </li>
      <li>
       Where the insurer is QBE or Helia (formerly Genworth), the amount payable is not less than $500, or
      </li>
      <li>
       Where the insurer is WLMI, WLMI-A or ALMI, the amount payable is not less than $400
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       For proposals which do not proceed
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td>
     <span>
      <span>
       If the proposal does not proceed for any reason and the premium has already been paid

 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="A_Why_this_policy">
  </a>
  <strong>
   1.1 Why this policy?
  </strong>
 </h3>
 The Bank may consider allowable variances to standard Consumer Policy for applications which are processed under this method and meet the requirements of this policy.
 <br/>
 <h2>
  <a id="2. Rules you must apply" name="2. Rules you must apply">
   <strong>
    2. Rules you must apply
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <a name="R_Overview">
  </a>
  <strong>
   2.1 Overview
  </strong>
 </h3>
 This policy outlines the allowable variances and requirements for accepting consumer mortgage applications under Streamlined Refinance.
 <br/>
 Where not otherwise detailed below, all other prevailing standard non-mortgage insured policies and product offerings for fully documented loans apply.
 <br/>
 <br/>
 This policy is to be read in conjunction with the policies and procedures contained in other sections of the Consumer Mortgage Credit Policy Manual.
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Where an application does not meet all eligibility requirements and other conditions of this policy, it is not eligible to be processed under Streamlined Refinance, but may be processed under standard policy, where meets all standard policy requirements.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <strong>
    No exception authority exists outside of these eligibility criteria for a streamlined assessment application
   </strong>
   <strong>
    .
   </strong>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <h3>
  <a id="2.2 Eligibility Criteria" name="2.2 Eligibility Criteria">
   <strong>
    2.2 Eligibility Criteria
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    To be eligible for this policy the below requirements must be met:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <table>
  <tbody>
   <tr>

         </span>
        </strong>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Refinance an existing mortgage (internal* or external)
        <b>
         only
        </b>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <b>
         *Note:
        </b>
        Allowable internal refinance transactions are limited to:
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           Switching between products
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           Increasing loan term of existing loan(s)
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           Loan consolidation(s) / amalgamation(s)
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           A new facility with a maximum top-up amount of $50,000 per customer/ customer group per 12 months
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr>

     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        <strong>
         <span>

         </span>
        </strong>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
     <br/>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>

         <span>
          Where:
         </span>
        </strong>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <strong>
           <span>

           </span>
          </strong>
          inclusive of any top-up / cash out amount
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <strong>
           <span>
            “current repayment” = minimum monthly contracted mortgage loan repayment
           </span>
          </strong>
          on the loan being refinanced, i.e.:
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           contracted monthly P&amp;I repayment amount for P&amp;I loans, and
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           the most recent months interest charge amount for Interest Only (IO) loans.
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>

         </span>
        </span>
       </span>

      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          refinance of a secured business debt, private loan, portfolio loan or other secured line of credit
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>

       <span>
        <span>
         <span>

         </span>
        </span>

 <h3>
  <br/>
  <a id="2.3 Streamlined Refinance - Serviceability" name="2.3 Streamlined Refinance - Serviceability">
   <strong>
    2.3 Streamlined Refinance - Serviceability
   </strong>
  </a>
 </h3>
 <p>
  Standard serviceability and income verification policy applies, refer
  <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000710">
   Serviceability Assessment
  </a>
  and
  <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000721">
   Verifying Income
  </a>
  .
 </p>
 <p>
  However, where all Streamlined Refinance eligibility criteria and conditions are met, but serviceability is not met under standard serviceability assessment, a modified Serviceability Assessment Rate (SAR) may be applied as an exception to serviceability policy as below, via referral to Credit:
 </p>
 <ul>
  <li>
   A minimum interest rate buffer of 1.00% (in lieu of 3.00%) will be applied in the Benchmark Repayment Amount, where SAR considers the final rate plus interest rate buffer in the serviceability calculation, for the new and / or any existing consumer mortgage liability(s)*.
  </li>
  <li>
   The standard Floor Rate will continue to apply in the Benchmark Repayment Amount Calculation, refer
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000710">
    Serviceability Assessment
   </a>
   &gt; Serviceability Assessment Rate (SAR) – Mortgage.
  </li>
 </ul>
 <p>
  Where Credit use this exception approach and approve an application based on a minimum 1% buffer SAR assessment, this must be captured as a servicing Override with Streamlined Refinance as the secondary reason code.
 </p>
 <p>
  *Secured mortgage types eligible to be assessed using the modified 1% approach, where serviceability is not met under standard serviceability policy:
 </p>
 <ul>
  <li>
   New consumer / residential lending:
   <ul>
    <li>
     Mortgages – Owner occupied and investment
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   Existing consumer / residential liabilities:
   <ul>
    <li>
     Mortgages – Owner occupied and investment
    </li>
    <li>
     Portfolio loans and other secured lines of credit
    </li>
    <li>
     Reverse mortgage (IO)
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
 </ul>

      </a>

     <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000698">
      Loan Application and Approval
     </a>

     </b>

   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="A_About_this_policy">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      1. About this policy
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h2>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="_1.1_Why_this">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      1.1 Why this policy?
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This policy will help you to identify a borrower’s eligibility for a Home Guarantee Scheme (HGS) backed consumer mortgage loan.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This offering only applies to WBC brand. It is not available to SGB / BoM / BSA.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="_1.2_What_is">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      1.2 What is the Home Guarantee Scheme (HGS)
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The Home Guarantee Scheme (HGS) is an Australian Government initiative aimed at supporting eligible borrowers to purchase an owner-occupied home without the need for mortgage insurance.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    The Home Guarantee Scheme includes:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      First Home Guarantee (FHBG)
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Regional First Home Buyer Guarantee (RFHBG)
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Family Home Guarantee (FHG)
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    For further information on the Home Guarantee Schemes, refer to
    <a href="https://www.nhfic.gov.au/">
     www.nhfic.gov.au
    </a>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="_1.3_Home_Guarantee">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      1.3 Home Guarantee Schemes (HGS) definitions

       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>
    </td>
    <td valign="top">

       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
     <br/>

        <b>

        <b>

 <h2>
  <a id="2. Rules you must apply" name="2. Rules you must apply">
   <span>
    <span>
     <strong>
      <span>
       2. Rules you must apply
      </span>
     </strong>
    </span>
   </span>
  </a>
 </h2>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="R_Overview">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      2.1 Overview
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This policy outlines Home Guarantee Schemes (HGS) that are supported for consumer mortgage loans and the borrower eligibility requirements for each scheme.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    All other prevailing
    <b>
     mortgage insured
    </b>
    policies for fully documented loans apply, i.e.:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Time in employment, refer
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000721">
       Verifying Income
      </a>
      &gt; PAYG Salary or Wage – Definitions and Time in Employment
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Commitment repayment history check for liabilities not on CCR, refer &gt;
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000690">
       Commitments
      </a>
      &gt; Financial hardship arrangement check and evidence satisfactory repayment history
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Valuation requirements, refer
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000686">
       Security Collateral Value Assessment
      </a>
      &gt; Rules you must apply
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Adverse bureau
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    This policy is to be read in conjunction with the policies and procedures contained in other sections of the Consumer Mortgage Credit Policy Manual
    <br/>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a id="_2.2_Eligibility criteria" name="_2.2_Eligibility criteria">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      2.2 Eligibility Criteria
     </span>
    </strong>
   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    To be eligible for any of the Home Guarantee Schemes defined in this policy, all of the below must be met:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Borrower(s) must:
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        be an Australian citizen
        <b>
         and
        </b>
        meet the definition of an individual borrower, refer
        <a data-tagid="_2.6_Verification_of" href="#_2.6_Verification_of">
         <span>
          <span>
           Verification of information provided by the borrower
          </span>
         </span>
        </a>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
        ,
        <b>
         and
        </b>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        comply with co-borrower eligibility requirements (where applicable), refer
        <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000694">
         Eligibility
        </a>
        &gt; Co-borrower eligibility requirements.
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Loan purpose is owner occupied purchase, construction (licensed builder) or refinance (internal or external)
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      The loan application is Principal and Interest (P&amp;I), excluding construction IO period, where applicable.
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Maximum loan term of 30 years inclusive of any construction period (where applicable), i.e.:
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Where the application is for the construction of an owner-occupied dwelling, the maximum loan term is 28 years.
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      The borrower’s
      <b>
       prior
      </b>
      <b>
       financial year
      </b>
      annual taxable income must not exceed the annual income limit:
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <ul>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Single borrower annual taxable income must be less than or equal to $125,000*
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
    <li>
     <span>
      <span>
       <span>
        Joint borrowers combined annual taxable income must be less than or equal to $200,000
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </li>
   </ul>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      The borrower(s) on the new loan must be the same as the purchaser / owner(s) of the security collateral property
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      The security collateral must be an acceptable property type, refer
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000682">
       Acceptable Security Collateral
      </a>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <strong>
       <span>
        Genuine savings must be met regardless of LVR, refer
       </span>
      </strong>
      <a data-tagid="2.5 Home Guarantee Scheme Conditions" href="#​​​​​​​2.5 Home Guarantee Scheme Conditions">
       <span>
        <span>
         Home Guarantee Scheme Conditions
        </span>
       </span>
      </a>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <strong>
       <span>
        Must not exceed maximum retained savings requirement, refer
       </span>
      </strong>
      <a data-tagid="_2.6_Verification_of" href="#_2.6_Verification_of">
       <span>
        <span>
         Verification of information provided by the borrower
        </span>
       </span>
      </a>
      <span>
       <span>
        <span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </span>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <strong>
       <span>
        Property purchase price does not exceed the maximum property price cap for the location, refer
       </span>
      </strong>
      <a href="https://www.nhfic.gov.au/support-buy-home/property-price-caps">
       Property Price Cap Tool
      </a>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <b>
     *Note:
    </b>
    Child support payments (where applicable) are excluded from the annual income limit, under
    <b>
    </b>
    Family Home Guarantee (FHG) scheme.
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    <b>
     Exclusions:
    </b>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Owner-builder or cost-plus constructions
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Unsecured debt consolidation or secured debt reduction
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Loan increase (top-up)
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      Guarantor(s) of any kind i.e. family, income, income plus security or security guarantee
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Refer also to
    <a data-tagid="​​​​​​​2.5 Home Guarantee Scheme Conditions" href="#​​​​​​​2.5 Home Guarantee Scheme Conditions">
     <span>
      <span>
       Home Guarantee Scheme Conditions
      </span>
     </span>
    </a>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <h3>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a name="_2.3_Verifying_Income">
    </a>
    <strong>
     <span>
      2.3
      <a>

      </a>
     </span>

   </span>
  </span>
 </h3>
 <span>
  <span>
   <span>
    Income and employment verification to Mortgage Insurance standards is required, refer:
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000721">
       Verifying Income
      </a>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
  <li>
   <span>
    <span>
     <span>
      <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000708">
       Self-employed Applicants
      </a>
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </li>
 </ul>

     <span>
      <span>

      </span>
     </span>
    </a>
    <span>
     <span>
      .
     </span>
    </span>
   </span>
  </span>
 </span>
 <table width="100%">

            HGS Type

    </td>

           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            The new loan is for the refinance of the same residential property that is presently mortgaged under the existing scheme-backed loan
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            For the purpose of paying out the existing Scheme-backed loan only, i.e. the new loan must not be:
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            <span>
             <span>
              o For an amount that is more than the permitted maximum loan amount, i.e. the scheduled principal balance of the existing scheme-backed loan as at the loan settlement date for the refinancing loan
             </span>
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            <span>
             <span>
              o For a term that is more than the permitted loan term remaining on the existing scheme-backed loan.
             </span>
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            The loan being refinanced must not be in arrears or default
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <strong>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            *Note:
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </strong>
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            Where the existing scheme-backed loan being refinanced is in joint names (FHBG or RFHBG only), it is acceptable for the new loan to be in the name of one or both existing borrowers, providing matches with name(s) on title
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span>
        <span>
         <span>
          <span>
           <span>
            It is not acceptable to add a borrower to the new loan
           </span>
          </span>
         </span>
        </span>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>

 <h2>
  <a name="Description">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     1. Description
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <span>
  <span>
   A variable rate Interest Capitalised loan for short-term finance, to enable the borrower to purchase a new owner-occupied residential property prior to an existing residential property being sold.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   The net sale proceeds of the existing property are used to repay the Bridging Loan in full.
   <br/>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <a name="Purpose">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     2. Purpose
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <span>
  <span>
   The loan funds
   <strong>
    <span>
     can
    </span>
   </strong>
  </span>
  <strong>
   <span>
    only
   </span>
  </strong>
 </span>
 be used for:
 <ul>
  <li>
   Owner Occupied property purchase
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   Also refer to Loan Purpose section of the
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000694">
    <em>
     <span>
      Eligibility
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   Policy.
   <br/>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h2>
  <a name="Eligibility">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     3. Eligibility
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <span>
  <span>
   Applicant(s) can be:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Individuals
  </li>
  <li>
   Discretionary or Family trusts (individual trustees only).
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   Owner occupied home loans can only be made available in the name of a trust if the beneficiaries are to occupy the property (i.e.
   <strong>
    <span>
     not
    </span>
   </strong>
  </span>
  the trustees).
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   Also refer to
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000694">
    <em>
     <span>
      Eligibility
     </span>
    </em>
   </a>
  </span>
 </span>
 <span>
  <span>
   policy &gt; Eligible Borrowers for a Consumer Mortgage Loan.
   <br/>
   <br/>
   <strong>
    <span>
     Not
    </span>
   </strong>
  </span>
  available for:
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Investment purposes
  </li>
  <li>
   Owner builders
  </li>
  <li>
   Partnerships
  </li>
  <li>
   Unit trusts
  </li>
  <li>
   Family-Security Guarantee
  </li>
  <li>
   Purchasing vacant land with no intention to complete a build within 12 months
  </li>
  <li>
   Companies
  </li>
  <li>
   2nd mortgages
  </li>
  <li>
   Loan increases
  </li>
  <li>
   Debt consolidation
  </li>
  <li>
   Refinances
  </li>
  <li>
   Business purposes
  </li>
  <li>
   Discretionary or Family trusts (non-individual trustees)
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h2>
  <a name="Security_collateral">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     4. Security collateral
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <span>
  <span>
   Security collateral:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   is to be a registered mortgage over the residential owner occupied property(s) and
  </li>
  <li>
   must include both the existing property (the current residence being sold)
   <strong>
    <span>
     and
    </span>
   </strong>
   the new property (the future residence being purchased)
  </li>
  <li>
   cannot be cross-collateralised to support other home loans
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h2>
  <a name="Special_conditions">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     5. Special conditions
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <ul>
  <li>
   A Bridging Loan can be originated in combination with another home loan
  </li>
  <li>
   The Bridging Loan must be repaid in full via the net sale proceeds of the existing (sale) property. Refer to
   <a href="#Sale_Equity_Rule">
    Sale Equity Rule
   </a>
  </li>
  <li>
   Maximum 12 month term
  </li>
  <li>
   Must comply with
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
    <em>
     Lending Value Ratio (LVR)
    </em>
   </a>
   policy for Bridging Loans
  </li>
  <li>
   The progressive drawdown option is
   <strong>
    <span>
     not
    </span>
   </strong>
   available
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h2>
  <a name="Sale_Equity_Rule">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     6. Sale Equity Rule
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
 <span>
  <span>
   To ensure the Bridging Loan will clear from the net sale proceeds of the existing property, the proposed Bridging portion of the loan cannot exceed:
  </span>
 </span>
 <ul>
  <li>
   85% of the security collateral value of the existing property(s) to be sold
  </li>
 </ul>
 <span>
  <span>
   This rule applies to the bridging portion of the loan only not any end debt.
  </span>
 </span>
 <br/>
 <br/>
 <span>
  <span>
   Also refer to ‘
  </span>
 </span>
 <em>
  <span>
   <span>
    <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000686">
     Security Collateral Value Assessment
    </a>
    ’
   </span>
  </span>
 </em>
 <span>
  <span>
   policy.
   <br/>
  </span>
 </span>
 <h3>
  <a name="Repayment_where_more_than_one_security_t">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     6.1 Repayment where more than one security to be sold
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h3>
 <ul>
  <li>
   Full net proceeds (including purchasers deposit paid) must always be received to the Bridging Loan
   <strong>
    <span>
     and
    </span>
   </strong>
  </li>
  <li>
   Remaining Bridging Loan debt against the security collateral value of the remaining property(s) to be sold cannot exceed the Sale Equity Rule
   <strong>
    <span>
     and
    </span>
   </strong>
  </li>
  <li>
   Overall LVR must comply with
   <a href="https://creditriskpolicies.westpac.com.au/app/answers/answer_view/a_id/1000684">
    <em>
     Lending Value Ratio (LVR)
    </em>
   </a>
   policy for Bridging Loans
  </li>
 </ul>
 <h2>
  <a name="Interest">
  </a>
  <strong>
   <span>
    <span>
     7. Interest
    </span>
   </span>
  </strong>
 </h2>
